programme.desc: Max is reunited with James, and old friend from medical school, who enters the ED with his fiancee Aisha after she falls victim to a seemingly spontaneous acid attack. Meanwhile, Elle reveals she wants to tell Blake that Jacob is his father, and when the lad is admitted to the department with a compass stuck through his hand, now seems as good a time as any

programme.title: The Bill

Starring Richard Griffiths and Samantha Janus

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The three doctors fall out when a consultant refuses to operate on their heart patient because he is a heavy smoker. Jack is unhappy because Beth has rejected his proposal and Will's marriage suffers another setback. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy falls out with her boyfriend, and Alistair tries to woo the elusive Judith, giving Jean the perfect chance to leap in with her infallible romantic advice - while the more sceptical Lionel stays well out of the way

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Grace offers the staff accommodation on the premises when their difficult journeys to work lead to demands for a travel allowance, but they soon find flat-sharing is not as easy as it seemed. Vintage comedy, starring John Inman and Mollie Sugden

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.desc: Compo buys Sid's wetsuit and, under Foggy's supervision, tries scuba diving and waterskiing. Bill Owen and Brian Wilde star

Feature-length detective drama, starring Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan, Joanna David, Ronald Pickup and Kaye Wragg

As the police investigation gets under way, friendships are tested to the limit

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Colin finally tells Karen all about Jim's scheme, but it is not long before the troubled officer's drug addiction comes to light, sullying his reputation further. programme.desc: The trio scheme to get Wally out from under Nora Batty's thumb for a day, but come a cropper sneaking him back to the house. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Joe Gladwin

programme.desc: Sister Reginald's ex-con brother Alfie shows up at the convent. The sisters agree to let him stay, but when an artist is found murdered, all eyes are on Alfie

programme.desc: Part one of a two-part adaptation of the second of JK Rowling's detective novels featuring private eye Cormoran Strike. programme.desc: Sharon is shocked by Sadie's latest revelation, Billy's best efforts backfire, and Kat joins forces with Anthony

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio stumble across a health farm on a day out, leading Foggy to devise an ingenious money-making scam - selling food to its famished inhabitants. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde

programme.desc: Clegg agrees to drive Ludovic's newly acquired van home for him, but finds the vehicle rather worse for wear. Rural comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Bryan Pringle

programme.title: Judge John Deed

programme.desc: A criminal who ran a £250,000 insurance racket is put back behind bars and a woman claiming for an injury cause by a faulty shoe is tripped up by her own evidence. A couple who put in a £30,000 injury claim are caught in a lie when their story doesn't add up and a wedding photographer's phoney claim for a ruined camera kit is exposed. A traveller who has a puncture on the way to the airport misses his flight but his claim falls flat when he submits a forged receipt for his new tyres. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore a holiday flat on the Ayrshire coast bought by reconnected childhood sweethearts, and properties in Wetherby and Windsor

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A new troop of colobus monkeys move onto Gorilla Island and keeper Rachel is locked in a battle of wills with Dave the Canadian timberwolf

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Free-range pig farming couple SJ and Nat, along with organic cattle farmers Emma and Ian, try to sell their home-grown food at the Lancashire Game and Country Festival

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is in Somerset and Dorset with a buyer from London, and also visits the town of Frome to learn how a fridge is helping to bring the local community together

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie and Ochuko visit Staffordshire on their hunt for antique treasures. A brass luggage rack from a railway carriage catches Margie's eye, she's expecting big bids on auction day. She's also charmed by an Edwardian spaniel that forces her to part with £30. Ochuko buys some antique dumbells and an enamel sign hoping for good fortune at auction but it's the little French birdcage he thinks will fly at auction

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Fiona, Nick, Amy and Laura compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Alex Scott present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney tries to tell Stacey what she has done but when they find out the van has been broken in to everything gets worse. Sharon helps Linda prepare for the party at The Vic as she struggles on her first Valentine's Day without Mick. Amy saves the day when Jack forgets the date but will it be enough for Denise?

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Everyone is excited for the end of term show and Danny has some good news to celebrate but the joy is short-lived when the past catches up with him, leading him to make a choice that could change the course of his life for ever. Drama, starring Angela Griffin, with Kym Marsh

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Filmed in the autumn of 2019, cameras follow a new cast of characters from the London Ambulance Service as they care for the nine million people of the city. In the first episode, ambulance crew members Kate and Femi are dispatched to a young man who is struggling to breathe during a severe anxiety attack. Meanwhile, just three hours into the morning shift, control deal with the third assault of the day, having already responded to four stabbings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen is desperate to get rid of Mitchell who has moved in after his girlfriend threw him out, so Class K and Stephen set out to transform Mitchell in the hope she'll take him back

programme.title: Wagspiracy: Vardy v Rooney
programme.desc: With access to key individuals who didn't give evidence at the trial, this documentary explores the hidden workings of the tabloids, PRs and agents connected to so-called 'Wagatha Christie', which followed accuisations between footballers' wives Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy. Contributors include Colin Paterson and Lizzie Cundy

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates jet off to the cosmopolitan city of Dubai to put on a corporate away day for two international clients based there. While one team show soff the glitz and glam of the location, the other goes for a more traditional approach in the desert. The team with the greater profit at the end wins and back on home soil it's the end of the road for another participant as Lord Sugar wields his axe

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Reg the Dalmatian is rushed in after eating a mystery object that has become stuck in his intestines. A scan shows the only way to get it out is to operate. Rupert the Cavalier King Charles Spaniel has an appointment in the Neurology department to get to the bottom of his headaches and Alexandria the cat is undergoing chemotherapy

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A pet owner lies about his dogs' disappearance and a serial scammer whose scheming got him a £50,000 pay out is put behind bars. A trio who claimed injuries by faking trips over drain covers are exposed and dodgy whiplash claims are proven false when online footage shows the supposed victims fighting fit in a boxing match. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.desc: Longleat keeper Caleb wants to find out who are the heroes and who are the zeros in lion country with a test of their intelligence. Calling on departments from across the estate, he tries to create a contraption that will see the lions work together as a team to release their food. Meanwhile, Ben Fogle tries to mend his ways with Rio the tearaway cockatoo and Longleat's very own spiderman tries to save a rare arachnid

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie and Ochuko travel along the Welsh border searching for antiques to sell at auction. Margie finds a Victorian oak barrel, noting the craftsman who made such containers are called 'coopers' she hopes her namesake will bring her luck. Ochuko finds an eclectic mix of items, a mirror, an American money box and some Danish egg cups are amongst the treasures he finds but what really catches his eye is some Sheffield silver

programme.desc: The Slaters prepare for Lily's first baby scan but it all falls apart when everyone is in the same room. Sharon is determined to help Linda when she confides in her about Janine wanting to sell Mick's half of The Vic

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Julianna Smith from Milton Keynes is hoping Mark Stuckey's mastery of electronics can bring a radio system, hand-made by her late father, back to life. Jacqui Clark arrives with an item that used to turn heads on the high streets of Kent over 100 years ago - a mini banana barrow. She is keen for metalwork expert Dominic Chinea to bring it back to its former glory. A leather wallet and a replica model of a fire engine also receive some much-needed attention. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Four years after the Daniels family moved into their home there are still moving boxes left unopened in the garage leaving little room for the family of five. Stacey, with the help of organiser Dilly, carpenter Rob and cleaner Iwan, puts all their belongings on display in a warehouse for them to see just how much unnecessary clutter they have including 492 DVDs, 35 happy birthday banners, 12 unopened chandeliers and 905 items of baby clothing

programme.desc: A Traitor's mask is at risk of slipping, and with suspicions rife at the Round Table, the mission sees the ghosts of former players return to the castle. The ultimate plot twist is revealed in the Traitors turret. Alan Cumming hosts the game of detection, backstabbing and trust

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: One player has the ultimate decision to make, a tall tale brings suspicion on one Traitor and the players engage in a harrowing mission while on a trip full of creepy cabins

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Puppy Coal, from the Dogs Trust is treated for aspiration pneumonia, caused by food going into his lungs. Border Collie puppy Grayson has broken his leg after falling off a bed and needs an operation to fix it. A new scan technique is used for the first time to check if labradoodle Poppy is cancer free

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A mother plays fast and loose with the facts to get a refund for her family holiday, a man clones someone else's identity to cash in on a high-value jewellery claim, while investigators do a double take when a tradesman claims his tools and his van were stolen twice over. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A pair of semi-detached cottages in Dormansland in Surrey, a semi-detached house in Chippenham in Wiltshire and a two-bedroom ground floor flat in Surbiton in south-west London are sold at online property auctions. Martin Roberts and Tommy Walsh meet the new owners, hearing their plans before the final finished properties are revealed

programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from the Lincolnshire Antiques and Home show, where experts Gary Pe and Jonathan Pratt help two teams to bag a bargain or two to take to auction. Plus, Eric uncovers the intriguing story behind a collection of postcards of the First World War era

programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble celebrate Longleat's families, looking back at archive footage of the safari park's first visitors and the moment 50 lions were released. They also follow keepers as the Animal Park team attempts to film the birth of some eagerly awaited cheetah cubs

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: East Sussex pig farmer Paul and Kent sheep farmer Hannah compete in front of the judges for prize rosettes at Edenbridge & Oxted Agricultural Show, with welcome help from their family and friends. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: In Norfolk, Alistair Appleton helps an opera singer and his husband find a house with space inside to hold small concerts and a garden big enough to keep a couple of pigs. During his time in the county, Alistair also meets a former fashion editor from London who uses social media to share the joys of her country life from her beautiful Georgian home

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri head to Worcestershire, where items that grab their attention include 19th-century porcelain, 1970s modern art and Margie's favourite stuff - silver

programme.desc: Emma Willis and Ronan Keating host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon moves forward with her plan to help Linda but Eve takes it as an opportunity to recompense her past actions. Lily makes a big decision about her future and Suki reveals her and Nish are recommitting their vows

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: An entrepreneur promoting portable toilets for youngsters hopes to flush away any doubts of success, while mushroom snacks with an impressive crunch prove too noisy for one potential investor. Plus, a sustainable clothing entrepreneur returns to the Den for a second time. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates are tasked to design a new lunchbox aimed at six-to-eight-year-olds, along with an app to encourage healthy eating. For one team, a clear vision helps them take a bite out of the market, though poor decisions and a lack of vision on the other side leads to dreary designs. In the boardroom there's no such thing as a free lunch, as one candidate is dismissed at the hands of Lord Sugar

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Rugby, Warwickshire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Satirist, presenter and producer Munya Chawawa, comedian Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and radio presenter Snoochie Shy join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: Michael presents another hour of entertainment, featuring music from Olly Murs, singing Dancing on Cars, and Stacey Dooley handing over her mobile in Send to All. There's a rude awakening for Alexander Armstrong when he plays the Midnight Gameshow and a pair of Unexpected Stars of the Show are invited to perform a duet

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri head to north-west England, where items include a 1940s fairground collectable and a silver egg cup with a royal connection

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Matt, Michael, Ruairi and Andy compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King explore Fife, on Scotland's east coast, and visit the Harbour Cafe. Amy is the chef who runs this place alongside husband Jack. The couple insist on using only local, seasonal produce, and fish fresh from the sea just yards from their front door. In April, they literally build the place up, and as the summer season ends, they take it down again. As the building is a temporary structure, there's no mains power, so Amy relies on a charcoal oven

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Ore Oduba in which contestants have to answer questions to get as far along a track as they can before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: In Stechford, Birmingham, Chris Bavin meets a group of determined volunteers entering their town into 'It's Your Neighbourhood', the entry level scheme of Bloom

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Barristers Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass look back at their oldest case yet, the 1839 murder by drowning of a female passenger aboard a commercial narrow boat in Staffordshire

programme.title: Earth's Greatest Spectacles
programme.desc: Svalbard in the Arctic spends many months of the year in complete darkness, an unrelenting frozen winter with temperatures down to minus 40C. However, as this documentary reveals when the sun finally reappears, the landscape magically transforms from an ice world into a rich tundra, full of exotic plants, birds, arctic foxes, polar bears, walrus and reindeer. This transformation is only possible thanks to some bizarre micro-organisms that feed on ice and the stunning abilities of migrating birds. Narrated by Domhnall Gleeson

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A visit to the Bala Autumn Sale in Snowdonia, north Wales, which is one of the UK's most important sheep dog auctions. Narrated by Stephen Tompkinson

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Philip Serrell hunt for objects to take to auction at Blackburn Cathedral, Lancashire. Charles values a wooden Fijian club, while two vintage enamel signs catch Philip's eye. Presenter Paul Martin takes a look at the impressive Talbot collection - local press photographs taken of events, celebrities and the royal family over a 50-year period

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick makes heritage cider with Raynor Winn, author of The Salt Path, and cooks chicken, leek and cider gratin for his friend John Harris, the head gardener at Tresillian House, who regales Rick with his memories of cider-making as a boy. The chef also meets a sea shanty group with a difference

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Malt loaf has been a popular teatime treat for more than 80 years. Consumers get through a staggering 130 million of them every year. So to get to grips with how this sweet cake cum bread is made, Gregg Wallace rolls up his sleeves to follow a production line of massive dough mixing, mind-boggling tin filling and intensely hot baking

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales serve up their canapes, starters and fish dishes on an animation and illustration theme. They include a lasagne inspired by Fireman Sam, a mushroom pastry based on Quentin Blake's illustrations of The Twits and a Pokemon rice pokeball with monkfish

programme.title: Inside Our Autistic Minds
programme.desc: Since sharing his own autism diagnosis with the world, naturalist and presenter Chris Packham has been flooded with messages from other autistic people, frustrated that their friends, families and colleagues don't understand them. In the first of two programmes, Chris sets out to bridge the gap, helping a group of people on the autism spectrum create short films that reveal to their family and friends what is really going on inside their minds. They include comedian Flo from Wiltshire and 20-year-old student Murray from Oxfordshire - the son of Radio 2 DJ Ken Bruce

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: The police investigate a huge hole that has been excavated, and Larry Bishop's invisible dogs have disappeared. Meanwhile, Andy and Lance have one last chance to pursue their hearts' desires. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Dark Waters (2019)
programme.desc: When a defence attorney takes on a lawsuit case against a chemical company, he finds a deep and rich trial in their history that unravels a history of pollution. Drama, starring Mark Ruffalo, Anne Hathaway, Tim Robbins, Bill Pullman and Bill Camp

programme.title: Tokyo Vice
programme.desc: Tozawa attends an yakuza peace summit and learns he is not above humiliation. Jake acts on an unexpected tip from Ishida

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: The team operate on a father of three to remove tumours growing in his neck, including one dangerously close to the spinal cord. It's a high-risk operation - but if the tumours are not removed they could eventually cause paralysis. Also going under the knife is a 19-year-old who has a cancerous mass growing off the largest vein in his body

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Chris Bavin meets volunteers in the market town of Chorley in Lancashire, where major construction work in the town centre is proving a massive challenge for the group

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Barristers Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass revisit the investigation into the mysterious murder of farmer Frederick Murton in Yorkshire in 1933

programme.title: Earth's Greatest Spectacles
programme.desc: Botswana's Okavango Delta is capable of supporting a wide variety of life, even though the lush wetland of islands and lagoons lies in the middle of the Kalahari Desert. As this film shows, each year a vast flood transforms the landscape and impacts on the lives of native species such as baboons, catfish, kingfishers, leopards, warthogs and elephants. More surprisingly, it also reveals how the flood creates this extraordinary delta in the first place thanks to the help of termites and hippos. Narrated by Domhnall Gleeson

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A three-day sale at the Royal Welsh Showground in Builth Wells, which sees horse enthusiasts gathering to buy and sell Welsh cobs, one of Britain's most popular breeds

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Anita Manning value items brought to Blackburn Cathedral. Anita discovers an Omar Ramsden spoon, and Charles finds an old silver bucket that has been used as a bin and a Christmas tree holder but turns out to be Faberge. Presenter Paul Martin learns about how mill workers in Blackburn during the Industrial Revolution were woken by a human alarm clock known as 'a knocker upper'

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick discovers Europe's largest tea plantation, on the banks of the River Fal, bakes a simple yet sumptuous fruited tea loaf and travels to Penzande, where he enjoys an invigorating dip in the UK's largest outdoor seawater lido. He also finds out how Cornwall inspired Charles Dickens and how the county found its way into A Christmas Carol

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace pays a visit to Ercol factory in Buckinghamshire, which makes 10,000 chairs every year. Here, he follows the production of one of this factory's best sellers, the Windsor chair. Elsewhere, Cherry Healey investigates how sitting too much could be very bad for people's health, and she helps to manage a sustainable woodland at the Rushmore Estate in Wiltshire

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The remaining three Welsh chefs compete over mains and desserts inspired by British animation and illustration, and Paddington's 65th birthday, to get through to the regional final. Before they begin, there's a surprise for them, with a new veteran scoring their dishes - Spencer Metzger, Head Chef at The Ritz and last year's Great British Menu Champion of Champions

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: A 17-year-old who developed scoliosis in adolescence has surgery to correct his extremely curved spine. But the procedure has its risks as the spinal cord is at the centre of the vertebrae where the surgeons must operate. The Addenbrooke's team also welcome a 75 -year-old woman who is having an operation to help with her bladder control

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Fearing an outbreak of scurvy, the crew stops in St Augustine, where the search for citrus leads to a run-in with a major figure from Jim's past. Meanwhile, after learning that Blackbeard is ready to move on to his next adventure, Stede forces his pirate friend and Lucius on a treasure hunt. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Rhys Darby

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Putin vs the West
programme.desc: Putin intensifies his aggression towards the West, from the Salisbury poisonings to clashes with Donald Trump over nuclear missiles, and fiery rhetoric aimed at NATO, concluding with the moment he launches his invasion of Ukraine. The Head of the CIA, Bill Burns, recounts his secret mission to Moscow to deliver a stark warning to Putin that US Intelligence was on to his plan to invade, while NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg tells of the last-ditch diplomatic efforts to avert war

programme.title: Inside Our Autistic Minds
programme.desc: Since sharing his own autism diagnosis with the world, naturalist and presenter Chris Packham has been flooded with messages from other autistic people, frustrated that their friends, families and colleagues don't understand them. In the first of two programmes, Chris sets out to bridge the gap, helping a group of people on the autism spectrum create short films that reveal to their family and friends what is really going on inside their minds. They include comedian Flo from Wiltshire and 20-year-old student Murray from Oxfordshire - the son of Radio 2 DJ Ken Bruce

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk visit Carol and her sons Keith and Thomas in Northamptonshire to help declutter after the death of husband and father John, an avid antiques collector. They set up their pop-up auction at the Avoncroft Museum of Historic Buildings in hope of finding the right bidders for John's collection. Carol plans to use any profits to renovate a memorial spot in her garden

programme.title: India: The Modi Question
programme.desc: The conclusion of a two-part documentary about Indian PM Narendra Modi, focusing on the track record of his government following his re-election in 2019. A series of controversial policies has been accompanied by reports of violent attacks on Muslims by Hindus. Modi and his government reject any suggestion that their policies reflect any prejudice towards Muslims - but these policies have been repeatedly criticised by human rights organisations such as Amnesty International

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A replica postbox used in a wedding ceremony and a battered but much-loved armchair are among the items transformed by the skilled team of remakers. Presented by Sabrina Grant

programme.desc: Butcher's assistant Natalie from Richmondshire takes the group to one of the most famous spots on Yorkshire's stunning coastline, Robin Hood's Bay

programme.title: Tom Kerridge: Lose Weight for Good
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, the chef takes the group of dieters on a river cruise to celebrate their weight loss over the past 12 weeks. Tom prepares a selection of sharing dishes for the special occasion, including couscous, griddled halloumi and Mediterranean vegetables, pulled pork tacos with salad, and falafels with a tzatziki dip

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Ore Oduba in which contestants have to answer questions to get as far along a track as they can before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Gardeners in Goring-on-Thames, Oxfordshire, aim to transform the train station, brighten up the pathway to the high street and fill the village with hanging baskets

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: The barristers return to their investigation of a curious case, a poultry farmer who buried the body of his fiancée under a chicken run, but claimed to be innocent of her murder

programme.title: Animals with Cameras
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan leads a team using specially designed on-board cameras to film groundbreaking new behaviour in some of the animals who depend on our oceans. In Cape Verde, Gordon starts the adventure with a look at one of the world's largest populations of nesting loggerhead turtles, before heading to the Bahamas with Caribbean reef sharks

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A visit to Exeter Livestock Market, the biggest agricultural auction in the region, where a team of auctioneers can sell more than 3,000 animals in a day

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At the City Hall in Kingston upon Hull, antiques experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper hunt for objects to take to auction. Caroline is entertained by the story behind some Laurel and Hardy autographs and David is gripped by a collection of postcards between young lovers from the Edwardian era. Presenter Paul Martin talks to playwright James Graham about the legacy of Hull's year as the UK's City of Culture

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee test their skills in a variety of trivia-based games, with the ultimate winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef glimpses life in Cornwall 2,000 years ago as he explores the atmospheric ruins of the ancient village of Carn Euny. Rick also cooks his favourite Sunday lunch, a hearty steak and kidney pudding, and goes for a bracing ride on a beautiful hand-built boat

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a factory tucked away in the village of Wollaston, Northamptonshire, that has been a key player in the boot making business for 120 years, producing boots for policemen and pop stars alike, and follows every step of production of a pair of Dr Martens original 1460 leather boots. Cherry Healey gets to grips with the speedy machines that use 350 metres of yarn to make a single pair of shoe laces, while historian Ruth Goodman reveals the story of a British shoemaker that elevated ladies' shoes from risqué music hall performers of the 19th century to gracing the feet of the Queen of England

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest-scoring chefs from Wales must go head-to-head and cook their six-course menus again. They need to impress Marcus Wareing, Nisha Katona, and Ed Gamble. There's also the guest judge, TV presenter Gethin Jones, who spent his life around animation at S4C before moving to Blue Peter. How will he judge dishes inspired by British animation and illustration and Paddington's 65th birthday?

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Louis supports the rebel colonies in America against France's old enemy, England, despite misgivings at court. Though still with no son, Antoinette moves to the Petite Trianon, where life is less formal. Then a face from the past, Swedish noble Count Fersen, arrives, complicating matters

programme.title: QI XS
programme.desc: A selection of classic clips from QI where things seem to be getting out of control. Sandi Toksvig hosts

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Tom Allen interviews the show's freshly rejected candidate, who reveals what it is really like to be in the firing line. Studio guests also discuss their views on what has happened in this week's episode

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: HMS Queen Elizabeth continues her journey to the South China Sea, but rampant Covid on board means she is not allowed to come ashore for any of the planned port visits. Sailing past Singapore and Hong Kong, the ship has become a floating prison, isolated on the high seas. Her dedicated supply ships do their best to keep the Queen Elizabeth topped up with food, fuel and ammunition. As the QE and her escorting destroyers and frigates enter the contested and potentially dangerous waters of the South China Sea, the Chinese Navy react by probing her with submarines and surface warships. Anti-submarine helicopters launch continually in order to identify, track and see off the subsurface threat

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: A 17-year-old who developed scoliosis in adolescence has surgery to correct his extremely curved spine. But the procedure has its risks as the spinal cord is at the centre of the vertebrae where the surgeons must operate. The Addenbrooke's team also welcome a 75 -year-old woman who is having an operation to help with her bladder control

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk help Helen and daughter Ruth in Leicestershire to declutter Helen's parent's home so she can move in her family of nine. They sort through generations of heirlooms and antiques picking out the best ones to sell at their pop-up auction in Stafford Castle

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: On its way to the far Pacific, HMS Queen Elizabeth ventures into the eastern Mediterranean. Britain's biggest warship is exercising its rights of navigation in international waters, but almost immediately Russian warships are diverted from the Black Sea to intercept it, while. Russian fighter bombers are also scrambled from their base in Syria to buzz the British task force and a tense stand-off unfolds

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Dorset, Michael Portillo visits Brownsea Island, where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of present scouts, the presenter learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys - and girls - today. In the New Forest, Michael searches out some unsung heroes of the First World War - the ponies who became war horses - and hears their story from a commoner who runs a stable and riding school. Then in Bournemouth, the one-time MP investigates a very British institution - the beach hut

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a scene that shows even a tiny shanty by a pond can be a warm place in the dead of winter

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: After years apart, Lionel is reunited with Jean but takes a bigger interest in her daughter. Each believes they have nothing in common any more. First episode of the comedy about late-blossoming love, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer. First broadcast in 1992

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: Luke realises he must fulfil his promise to Maxine and spend a whole weekend with her. Carla Lane comedy, starring Felicity Kendal and Jack Galloway. From 1985

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Binham Priory in Norfolk provides the starting point for a brief history of Catholicism in England during the Reformation, from Henry VIII's initial break with Rome to the beginning of Elizabeth I's reign

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: An investigation into a powerful spyware called Pegasus, sold to governments around the world by Israeli company NSO Group, and used on journalists, activists and others, including both the wife and fiancee of Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: Richard Miles explores the rise and fall of the Roman empire, which at the height of its power, extended the benefits of its civilisation to a staggering 60 million subjects and citizens, from Hadrian's Wall to the banks of the Euphrates. The archaeologist and historian also learns how the expansion of Christianity filled a gap left by the Roman multi-god belief system, eventually leading to the instalment of Constantine as the first Christian emperor

programme.title: The Magic of Mushrooms
programme.desc: Richard Fortey examines the world of mushrooms in a specially built laboratory with the help of mycologist Patrick Hickey. Together, they reveal the ability of fungi to break down waste and sustain new plant life, keeping the planet alive. Richard also travels across Britain and further afield to reveal their mysterious life cycles and how they have the potential to open new frontiers in science, medicine and technology

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Dorset, Michael Portillo visits Brownsea Island, where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of present scouts, the presenter learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys - and girls - today. In the New Forest, Michael searches out some unsung heroes of the First World War - the ponies who became war horses - and hears their story from a commoner who runs a stable and riding school. Then in Bournemouth, the one-time MP investigates a very British institution - the beach hut

programme.title: Byzantium: A Tale of Three Cities
programme.desc: Historian Simon Sebag Montefiore explores modern Istanbul in search of evidence of the last centuries of Christian Constantinople, which produced a golden artistic renaissance. There's also a look at how, after the epic siege of 1453, the Ottomans seized control of the city, which became their imperial capital

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Binham Priory in Norfolk provides the starting point for a brief history of Catholicism in England during the Reformation, from Henry VIII's initial break with Rome to the beginning of Elizabeth I's reign

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from the coalfields of South Wales to the southernmost tip of Cornwall, travelling from Whitland, Carmarthenshire, to Swansea

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross paints an old dirt road leading up to a quaint country barn nestled in nature's greenery

programme.title: Michael Palin's New Europe
programme.desc: The veteran traveller journeys through Poland from the port of Gdansk in the north to the Slovakian border in the south, visiting Auschwitz, Czestochowa and Warsaw. He explores the historical heritage of the nation, finds time to perform a cameo role with Poland's most famous cabaret group and appears on breakfast TV

programme.title: Inside Porton Down: Britain's Secret Weapons Research Facility
programme.desc: Dr Michael Mosley investigates Britain's most secretive and controversial military research base, Porton Down, in a programme originally shown on its 100th anniversary in 2016. He learns about chemical and biological weapons old and new, reveals the truth about animal and human testing, and discovers how the latest science and technology are helping to defend the UK against terrorist attacks and rogue nations

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: A policeman discovers his murdered daughter was an eco-terrorist involved in a raid on a nuclear plant, and his search for her killer becomes a gripping journey to the heart of the nuclear state. Troy Kennedy Martin's acclaimed political thriller, starring Bob Peck in a Bafta-winning role, with Joanne Whalley, Joe Don Baker and Ian McNeice

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens explores Wales' cultural history, beginning on Anglesey where he steps inside a prehistoric burial chamber to witness Welsh art in its earliest form. He also views an exquisite example of Bronze Age artistry in the shape of a gold cape, found by chance in a field in north Wales and now one of the prize exhibits in the British Museum

programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross paints a beautiful monochromatic scene with delicate leafless trees and a rich grassy meadow surrounding a sweet cottage

programme.title: Queen Victoria's Letters: A Monarch Unveiled
programme.desc: Part one of two. Queen Victoria's journals and letters are read by Anna Chancellor throughout

And Chantelle joins Aneeshwar, who is a keen bird watcher - together they try to spot a puffling, a baby puffin, in the cliffs. Chantelle and Rory’s fact files help answer all of Emily’s questions. With the help of the special poem, we discover that like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, puffins are superheroes, helping our planet in their own special way. And for this episode’s Teeny Tiny Task, Rory and Sandy decide to be 'more puffin' and decorate each other’s faces with faceprints.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

Sylvie knows the children will be feeling nervous and excited all at once. The children are nervous, so Sylvie offers to go first. programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The Go Jetters are going to Westman Islands, Iceland, where the world's largest colony of Atlantic puffins gathers every year. Lars loves these tough little birds and explains how, although they spend most of their lives flying out to sea and fishing, they return to land each year to lay their eggs. When the baby birds, also called pufflings, eventually hatch, they fly out towards the ocean. But the light from nearby towns often confuses them about where to go, leading local children and adults to form 'puffin patrols' to rescue the pufflings. Lars is excited to help out but is upset when he discovers Glitch, also a fan of puffins, is already well-known on the islands for his skills as a puffin rescuer. Although Glitch offers him a place in his puffin patrol, Lars is determined to outdo Glitch with a patrol of his own - but when he recruits a clumsy Grimbot, things take a turn for the worse...

programme.title: The Toddler Club
programme.desc: Nigel, Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear welcome toddlers Layla, Maisy, Chester and Francis, and their grown-ups, to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! The What’s in the Box? game reveals a wooden triangle toy, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are inspired by shapes. This theme is explored through play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate shapes toy or object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler. Storytime is all about discovering new words, as Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear look for lots of different shapes at home and when they’re out and about. Viewers at home show how they’ve been exploring the shapes theme too. Plus, The Circle Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with stretching and the Goodbye song.

programme.desc: Love Monster has been chosen as the prize-picker at the Harvest Day contest, but when he gets there it turns out there is only one prize and three teams. This means he has to choose a winner between his friends - Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, Bad Idea Puppy and the In-Chicks. Round one is fancy fashion foodies, and everyone loves Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, so Love Monster thinks he can just pick her. Then it is round two - the veggie variety show. Everyone loves the In-Chicks, so Love Monster now has to choose between them and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. Then it is the final round, which is the tantalizing taste test of home grown goodies, and this time everyone loves Bad Idea Puppy. Love Monster has no idea how he can pick a winner and runs off and hides, but then he realises Bad Idea Puppy always makes him laugh, so he declares him the winner.

programme.desc: Tinks is a disability assistance dog for her owner Charli, who has a condition that makes it painful for her to pick things up or to push and pull things. Tinks uses her superfetch skills to help Charli every day. The smallest of the Dog Squad gang, Tinks is a little Lhasa Apso with lots of big dog energy. Charli has been invited to a party but is feeling a bit nervous about going. Tinks loves helping Charli feel confident. She wants to help Charli feel good about herself so she can go and have fun at the party. Tinks fetches Charli’s hair brush so Charli can brush her newly-dyed pink hair, and then helps Charli choose a party outfit. And, when Charli can’t find her keys, Tinks dives into a mountain of clothes on the bed to search for them. Now they’re party ready, but it's raining! Tinks is determined to help Charli get to the party, even in the rain. But how? She summons all her big dog energy and sets off in search of a plan. Just wait until Dog Squad hear about this!

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: X-Ray
programme.desc: A report from Llandudno on a home improvement firm with some seriously unhappy customers. Plus, a look at the success of community cinemas

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A pet owner lies about his dogs' disappearance and a serial scammer whose scheming got him a £50,000 pay out is put behind bars. A trio who claimed injuries by faking trips over drain covers are exposed and dodgy whiplash claims are proven false when online footage shows the supposed victims fighting fit in a boxing match. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The development progress of a former police station in Sheldon, Birmingham, a terraced house in Great Yarmouth and a site with 24 garages in Alcester in Worcestershire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp is at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, where David Harper and Raj Bisram help two teams find items of potential value to take to acution. Natasha also visits the Millennium Seed Bank and learns about a tree saved from the brink of extinction

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Longleat keeper Caleb wants to find out who are the heroes and who are the zeros in lion country with a test of their intelligence. Calling on departments from across the estate, he tries to create a contraption that will see the lions work together as a team to release their food. Meanwhile, Ben Fogle tries to mend his ways with Rio the tearaway cockatoo and Longleat's very own spiderman tries to save a rare arachnid

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Alpaca farmers from Lancashire and Northumberland are hoping their hard work preparing to compete at the Westmorland County Show will be rewarded by success in the judging ring

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a buyer keen to move to Pembrokeshire in the Welsh countryside. He also tests the therapeutic benefits of a dip in the cold sea, wearing nothing warmer than his swimming trunks

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie and Ochuko travel along the Welsh border searching for antiques to sell at auction. Margie finds a Victorian oak barrel, noting the craftsman who made such containers are called 'coopers' she hopes her namesake will bring her luck. Ochuko finds an eclectic mix of items, a mirror, an American money box and some Danish egg cups are amongst the treasures he finds but what really catches his eye is some Sheffield silver

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Joe, Liz, Jamie and Nichola compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Welsh Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Slaters prepare for Lily's first baby scan but it all falls apart when everyone is in the same room. Sharon is determined to help Linda when she confides in her about Janine wanting to sell Mick's half of The Vic

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of Doug Mountjoy, the former miner from the South Wales Valleys who swapped life underground for the snooker club and became one of Britain's most successful players

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Documentary in which reality star and TV presenter Scarlett Moffatt sets out to finally pass her driving test - on the 14th attempt - and also helps other luckless would-be drivers who, like her, have been learning for decades. First up is 25-year-old Jess, who has clocked up hundreds of hours of lessons over eight years. Some instructors will no longer get in a car with her, so stepdad Richard is her last chance as she tackles the five-day course at Scarlett's driving school

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Four years after the Daniels family moved into their home there are still moving boxes left unopened in the garage leaving little room for the family of five. Stacey, with the help of organiser Dilly, carpenter Rob and cleaner Iwan, puts all their belongings on display in a warehouse for them to see just how much unnecessary clutter they have including 492 DVDs, 35 happy birthday banners, 12 unopened chandeliers and 905 items of baby clothing

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC Wales Live
programme.desc: Bethan Rhys Roberts presents the weekly show featuring stories and in-depth interviews about what is happening in Wales and why it matters

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: A Traitor's mask is at risk of slipping, and with suspicions rife at the Round Table, the mission sees the ghosts of former players return to the castle. The ultimate plot twist is revealed in the Traitors turret. Alan Cumming hosts the game of detection, backstabbing and trust

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: One player has the ultimate decision to make, a tall tale brings suspicion on one Traitor and the players engage in a harrowing mission while on a trip full of creepy cabins

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones co-host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Bear the Pomeranian comes in with a broken leg, luckily surgeon Laura fits a tiny metal plate to fix the bones. Colin the Basset Hound comes for a check up after several bouts of pneumonia and Esme the cat is rushed into the ICU after being brought in for excessive vomiting when the vets are worried about her breathing

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A mother plays fast and loose with the facts to get a refund for her family holiday, a man clones someone else's identity to cash in on a high-value jewellery claim, while investigators do a double take when a tradesman claims his tools and his van were stolen twice over. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A pair of semi-detached cottages in Dormansland in Surrey, a semi-detached house in Chippenham in Wiltshire and a two-bedroom ground floor flat in Surbiton in south-west London are sold at online property auctions. Martin Roberts and Tommy Walsh meet the new owners, hearing their plans before the final finished properties are revealed

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from the Lincolnshire Antiques and Home show, where experts Gary Pe and Jonathan Pratt help two teams to bag a bargain or two to take to auction. Plus, Eric uncovers the intriguing story behind a collection of postcards of the First World War era

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble celebrate Longleat's families, looking back at archive footage of the safari park's first visitors and the moment 50 lions were released. They also follow keepers as the Animal Park team attempts to film the birth of some eagerly awaited cheetah cubs

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: East Sussex pig farmer Paul and Kent sheep farmer Hannah compete in front of the judges for prize rosettes at Edenbridge & Oxted Agricultural Show, with welcome help from their family and friends. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: In Norfolk, Alistair Appleton helps an opera singer and his husband find a house with space inside to hold small concerts and a garden big enough to keep a couple of pigs. During his time in the county, Alistair also meets a former fashion editor from London who uses social media to share the joys of her country life from her beautiful Georgian home

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri head to Worcestershire, where items that grab their attention include 19th-century porcelain, 1970s modern art and Margie's favourite stuff - silver

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Best friends Néamh, Ollie, Rosa and Nathan compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Ronan Keating host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon moves forward with her plan to help Linda but Eve takes it as an opportunity to recompense her past actions. Lily makes a big decision about her future and Suki reveals her and Nish are recommitting their vows

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: An entrepreneur promoting portable toilets for youngsters hopes to flush away any doubts of success, while mushroom snacks with an impressive crunch prove too noisy for one potential investor. Plus, a sustainable clothing entrepreneur returns to the Den for a second time. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates are tasked to design a new lunchbox aimed at six-to-eight-year-olds, along with an app to encourage healthy eating. For one team, a clear vision helps them take a bite out of the market, though poor decisions and a lack of vision on the other side leads to dreary designs. In the boardroom there's no such thing as a free lunch, as one candidate is dismissed at the hands of Lord Sugar

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Rugby, Warwickshire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Satirist, presenter and producer Munya Chawawa, comedian Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and radio presenter Snoochie Shy join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: Michael presents another hour of entertainment, featuring music from Olly Murs, singing Dancing on Cars, and Stacey Dooley handing over her mobile in Send to All. There's a rude awakening for Alexander Armstrong when he plays the Midnight Gameshow and a pair of Unexpected Stars of the Show are invited to perform a duet

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Bear the Pomeranian comes in with a broken leg, luckily surgeon Laura fits a tiny metal plate to fix the bones. Colin the Basset Hound comes for a check up after several bouts of pneumonia and Esme the cat is rushed into the ICU after being brought in for excessive vomiting when the vets are worried about her breathing

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A criminal who ran a £250,000 insurance racket is put back behind bars and a woman claiming for an injury cause by a faulty shoe is tripped up by her own evidence. A couple who put in a £30,000 injury claim are caught in a lie when their story doesn't add up and a wedding photographer's phoney claim for a ruined camera kit is exposed. A traveller who has a puncture on the way to the airport misses his flight but his claim falls flat when he submits a forged receipt for his new tyres. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore a holiday flat on the Ayrshire coast bought by reconnected childhood sweethearts, and properties in Wetherby and Windsor

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Narbeth, South Wales, and learns about the 17th-century Welsh tradition of carving lovespoons. With experts Philip Serrell and Kate Bliss

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A new troop of colobus monkeys move onto Gorilla Island and keeper Rachel is locked in a battle of wills with Dave the Canadian timberwolf

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Free-range pig farming couple SJ and Nat, along with organic cattle farmers Emma and Ian, try to sell their home-grown food at the Lancashire Game and Country Festival

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is in Somerset and Dorset with a buyer from London, and also visits the town of Frome to learn how a fridge is helping to bring the local community together

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie and Ochuko visit Staffordshire on their hunt for antique treasures. A brass luggage rack from a railway carriage catches Margie's eye, she's expecting big bids on auction day. She's also charmed by an Edwardian spaniel that forces her to part with £30. Ochuko buys some antique dumbells and an enamel sign hoping for good fortune at auction but it's the little French birdcage he thinks will fly at auction

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Fiona, Nick, Amy and Laura compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Alex Scott present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney tries to tell Stacey what she has done but when they find out the van has been broken in to everything gets worse. Sharon helps Linda prepare for the party at The Vic as she struggles on her first Valentine's Day without Mick. Amy saves the day when Jack forgets the date but will it be enough for Denise?

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Everyone is excited for the end of term show and Danny has some good news to celebrate but the joy is short-lived when the past catches up with him, leading him to make a choice that could change the course of his life for ever. Drama, starring Angela Griffin, with Kym Marsh

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Filmed in the autumn of 2019, cameras follow a new cast of characters from the London Ambulance Service as they care for the nine million people of the city. In the first episode, ambulance crew members Kate and Femi are dispatched to a young man who is struggling to breathe during a severe anxiety attack. Meanwhile, just three hours into the morning shift, control deal with the third assault of the day, having already responded to four stabbings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen is desperate to get rid of Mitchell who has moved in after his girlfriend threw him out, so Class K and Stephen set out to transform Mitchell in the hope she'll take him back

programme.title: Wagspiracy: Vardy v Rooney
programme.desc: With access to key individuals who didn't give evidence at the trial, this documentary explores the hidden workings of the tabloids, PRs and agents connected to so-called 'Wagatha Christie', which followed accuisations between footballers' wives Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy. Contributors include Colin Paterson and Lizzie Cundy

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates jet off to the cosmopolitan city of Dubai to put on a corporate away day for two international clients based there. While one team show soff the glitz and glam of the location, the other goes for a more traditional approach in the desert. The team with the greater profit at the end wins and back on home soil it's the end of the road for another participant as Lord Sugar wields his axe
