She's also charmed by an Edwardian spaniel that forces her to part with £30. Ochuko buys some antique dumbells and an enamel sign hoping for good fortune at auction but it's the little French birdcage he thinks will fly at auction

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Fiona, Nick, Amy and Laura compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Alex Scott present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney tries to tell Stacey what she has done but when they find out the van has been broken in to everything gets worse. Sharon helps Linda prepare for the party at The Vic as she struggles on her first Valentine's Day without Mick. Amy saves the day when Jack forgets the date but will it be enough for Denise?

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Everyone is excited for the end of term show and Danny has some good news to celebrate but the joy is short-lived when the past catches up with him, leading him to make a choice that could change the course of his life for ever. Drama, starring Angela Griffin, with Kym Marsh

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Filmed in the autumn of 2019, cameras follow a new cast of characters from the London Ambulance Service as they care for the nine million people of the city. In the first episode, ambulance crew members Kate and Femi are dispatched to a young man who is struggling to breathe during a severe anxiety attack. Meanwhile, just three hours into the morning shift, control deal with the third assault of the day, having already responded to four stabbings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Patrick Bradley meets a couple planning to restore a fisherman's cottage in Lough Neagh. After their friend Phyllis, who was born and lived her whole life in there, passed away. Their sentimental attachment means they want to keep as much of the character as possible but since the fabric of the cottage has seen better day this proves to be a challenge. Patrick takes the couple to the Ulster Folk Museum to learn about what life would have been like for the fishermen who once lived in the cottage and they use science to determine when it was originally built

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen is desperate to get rid of Mitchell who has moved in after his girlfriend threw him out, so Class K and Stephen set out to transform Mitchell in the hope she'll take him back

programme.title: Wagspiracy: Vardy v Rooney
programme.desc: With access to key individuals who didn't give evidence at the trial, this documentary explores the hidden workings of the tabloids, PRs and agents connected to so-called 'Wagatha Christie', which followed accuisations between footballers' wives Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy. Contributors include Colin Paterson and Lizzie Cundy

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates jet off to the cosmopolitan city of Dubai to put on a corporate away day for two international clients based there. While one team show soff the glitz and glam of the location, the other goes for a more traditional approach in the desert. The team with the greater profit at the end wins and back on home soil it's the end of the road for another participant as Lord Sugar wields his axe

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Reg the Dalmatian is rushed in after eating a mystery object that has become stuck in his intestines. A scan shows the only way to get it out is to operate. Rupert the Cavalier King Charles Spaniel has an appointment in the Neurology department to get to the bottom of his headaches and Alexandria the cat is undergoing chemotherapy

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A pet owner lies about his dogs' disappearance and a serial scammer whose scheming got him a £50,000 pay out is put behind bars. A trio who claimed injuries by faking trips over drain covers are exposed and dodgy whiplash claims are proven false when online footage shows the supposed victims fighting fit in a boxing match. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The development progress of a former police station in Sheldon, Birmingham, a terraced house in Great Yarmouth and a site with 24 garages in Alcester in Worcestershire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp is at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, where David Harper and Raj Bisram help two teams find items of potential value to take to acution. Natasha also visits the Millennium Seed Bank and learns about a tree saved from the brink of extinction

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Longleat keeper Caleb wants to find out who are the heroes and who are the zeros in lion country with a test of their intelligence. Calling on departments from across the estate, he tries to create a contraption that will see the lions work together as a team to release their food. Meanwhile, Ben Fogle tries to mend his ways with Rio the tearaway cockatoo and Longleat's very own spiderman tries to save a rare arachnid

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Alpaca farmers from Lancashire and Northumberland are hoping their hard work preparing to compete at the Westmorland County Show will be rewarded by success in the judging ring

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a buyer keen to move to Pembrokeshire in the Welsh countryside. He also tests the therapeutic benefits of a dip in the cold sea, wearing nothing warmer than his swimming trunks

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie and Ochuko travel along the Welsh border searching for antiques to sell at auction. Margie finds a Victorian oak barrel, noting the craftsman who made such containers are called 'coopers' she hopes her namesake will bring her luck. Ochuko finds an eclectic mix of items, a mirror, an American money box and some Danish egg cups are amongst the treasures he finds but what really catches his eye is some Sheffield silver

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Joe, Liz, Jamie and Nichola compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Slaters prepare for Lily's first baby scan but it all falls apart when everyone is in the same room. Sharon is determined to help Linda when she confides in her about Janine wanting to sell Mick's half of The Vic

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers bid against one another to buy a retro Battling Tops game, a set of shelves that turns into a table, and a collection of vintage bikes. Nigel Havers presents

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Documentary in which reality star and TV presenter Scarlett Moffatt sets out to finally pass her driving test - on the 14th attempt - and also helps other luckless would-be drivers who, like her, have been learning for decades. First up is 25-year-old Jess, who has clocked up hundreds of hours of lessons over eight years. Some instructors will no longer get in a car with her, so stepdad Richard is her last chance as she tackles the five-day course at Scarlett's driving school

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Four years after the Daniels family moved into their home there are still moving boxes left unopened in the garage leaving little room for the family of five. Stacey, with the help of organiser Dilly, carpenter Rob and cleaner Iwan, puts all their belongings on display in a warehouse for them to see just how much unnecessary clutter they have including 492 DVDs, 35 happy birthday banners, 12 unopened chandeliers and 905 items of baby clothing

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: The story behind one of Belfast's most ambitious house renovations, following Pete and Ciara Boyle as they attempt to restore Ormiston House, built in 1867 for a local mill owner

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: A Traitor's mask is at risk of slipping, and with suspicions rife at the Round Table, the mission sees the ghosts of former players return to the castle. The ultimate plot twist is revealed in the Traitors turret. Alan Cumming hosts the game of detection, backstabbing and trust

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: One player has the ultimate decision to make, a tall tale brings suspicion on one Traitor and the players engage in a harrowing mission while on a trip full of creepy cabins

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones co-host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Puppy Coal, from the Dogs Trust is treated for aspiration pneumonia, caused by food going into his lungs. Border Collie puppy Grayson has broken his leg after falling off a bed and needs an operation to fix it. A new scan technique is used for the first time to check if labradoodle Poppy is cancer free

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A mother plays fast and loose with the facts to get a refund for her family holiday, a man clones someone else's identity to cash in on a high-value jewellery claim, while investigators do a double take when a tradesman claims his tools and his van were stolen twice over. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A pair of semi-detached cottages in Dormansland in Surrey, a semi-detached house in Chippenham in Wiltshire and a two-bedroom ground floor flat in Surbiton in south-west London are sold at online property auctions. Martin Roberts and Tommy Walsh meet the new owners, hearing their plans before the final finished properties are revealed

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from the Lincolnshire Antiques and Home show, where experts Gary Pe and Jonathan Pratt help two teams to bag a bargain or two to take to auction. Plus, Eric uncovers the intriguing story behind a collection of postcards of the First World War era

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble celebrate Longleat's families, looking back at archive footage of the safari park's first visitors and the moment 50 lions were released. They also follow keepers as the Animal Park team attempts to film the birth of some eagerly awaited cheetah cubs

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: East Sussex pig farmer Paul and Kent sheep farmer Hannah compete in front of the judges for prize rosettes at Edenbridge & Oxted Agricultural Show, with welcome help from their family and friends. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: In Norfolk, Alistair Appleton helps an opera singer and his husband find a house with space inside to hold small concerts and a garden big enough to keep a couple of pigs. During his time in the county, Alistair also meets a former fashion editor from London who uses social media to share the joys of her country life from her beautiful Georgian home

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri head to Worcestershire, where items that grab their attention include 19th-century porcelain, 1970s modern art and Margie's favourite stuff - silver

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Best friends Néamh, Ollie, Rosa and Nathan compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Ronan Keating host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon moves forward with her plan to help Linda but Eve takes it as an opportunity to recompense her past actions. Lily makes a big decision about her future and Suki reveals her and Nish are recommitting their vows

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: An entrepreneur promoting portable toilets for youngsters hopes to flush away any doubts of success, while mushroom snacks with an impressive crunch prove too noisy for one potential investor. Plus, a sustainable clothing entrepreneur returns to the Den for a second time. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates are tasked to design a new lunchbox aimed at six-to-eight-year-olds, along with an app to encourage healthy eating. For one team, a clear vision helps them take a bite out of the market, though poor decisions and a lack of vision on the other side leads to dreary designs. In the boardroom there's no such thing as a free lunch, as one candidate is dismissed at the hands of Lord Sugar

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Race to Disaster - The Ards TT
programme.desc: From 1928 to 1936 the Ards TT attracted Asian royalty, Italian icons and even notorious convicts to race their priceless machines through the streets of County Down. Half a million spectators would watch on as Sir Malcolm Campbell, Rudi Carraciola and Tazio Nuvolari drove for up to six hours through Newtownards and Comber on the narrow bumpy roads. Year on year speeds increased, and in 1936 a car driven by Belfastman Jack Chambers ploughed into spectators. Using rare archive footage, Mark Thompson reveals the story of the Ards TT, ultimately one of tragedy

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Rugby, Warwickshire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Satirist, presenter and producer Munya Chawawa, comedian Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and radio presenter Snoochie Shy join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: Michael presents another hour of entertainment, featuring music from Olly Murs, singing Dancing on Cars, and Stacey Dooley handing over her mobile in Send to All. There's a rude awakening for Alexander Armstrong when he plays the Midnight Gameshow and a pair of Unexpected Stars of the Show are invited to perform a duet

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The pipe-smoking detective returns to his home town to investigate an anonymous warning that a crime is about to be committed in St Fiacre's Church. Detective series, starring Michael Gambon

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A kidnapping case takes an unexpected turn, placing the entire village in danger. Meanwhile, Nick meets new schoolteacher Jo, and Blaketon enjoys his status as president of the local rugby club - until Greengrass takes an interest

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Rowan begins to take part in village life again with the help of Auntie Eileen, a man assaults two policemen and escapes on his way to prison and Greengrass takes a job as a lollipop man. Drama, starring Nick Berry

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A professor is found dead on Halloween with a stake through her heart and Hobson reveals she shared a house with the victim in her university days. A medium visits Lewis claiming to have foreseen the tragedy, and ghostly messages spelled out in fridge magnet letters start appearing in a house occupied by four students. As the detective struggles with the possibility his friend is somehow implicated in the crime, a tale of jealousy and revenge begins to unfold. Rupert Graves (Sherlock) and Niamh Cusack (Heartbeat) guest star

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Detective drama set in the 1950s about a vicar and a police inspector solving crimes in rural Cambridgeshire. DC Phil Wilkinson arrests Sidney on a charge of sexual assault made by Harding Redmond after reading entries in the diary of his teenage daughter Abigail, who has now gone missing, along with the journal itself. After being grilled by DCI Benson, Sidney sets out to prove his innocence and is joined in his investigation by Geordie. James Norton and Robson Green star

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Geordie calls on Sidney for help as he investigates the apparent suicide of a Cambridge lecturer, who was found dead after falling from the spire of King's College Chapel. His wife and his star pupil, who used to partake in daredevil climbs of the college buildings alongside his mentor, are convinced he was too happy and content for it to be suicide. It appears to be a case of night climbing misadventure, until a student witness comes forward, leading Sidney and Geordie into a world of espionage and secrets. Detective drama, starring James Norton, Robson Green and Morven Christie

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Baby Alfie is rushed to hospital after suffering a fit, leaving Ruth and Simon beside themselves with worry and guilt. Vic's proposal for a merger between the two rival rugby teams meets with opposition, while Tom Lewis has one of those days _ first he's made redundant, and then he gets into a fight with a man he suspects is having an affair with his wife. Drama, starring Sarah Lancashire

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Simmering tensions in the Goddard household come to a head as Ruth gives Simon his marching orders, enraged to discover he's remortgaged the house without consulting her. Meanwhile, Stephen reacts badly to the news that fellow teacher Martin Williams has attempted suicide - and responds by seeking solace in Jacqui's arms. Sarah Lancashire, Jason Done, Pam Ferris and Tony Haygarth star

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of a trainee forensic psychologist, whose body has been dumped in a Northumberland landfill site, surroundings that make evidence of how she died impossible to verify. Vera discovers that the dead woman had been working for the prison service re-investigating a crime that a former prisoner had been convicted of, and realises she must finish what the victim started in order to discover who may have wanted her dead. Paul Kaye plays a new pathologist alongside fellow guest star Peter Davison

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A young man sat alone in the church and covered in blood confesses to Sidney and Geordie that he attacked and killed his landlord. However, when the pair investigate further, they find the alleged victim alive and well with his family. Elsewhere, Margaret's visits to the vicarage begin to leave Mrs Maguire irritated, Leonard is distracted by secretive trips to the cinema, and Geordie is compelled to deal with a surprising shoplifter. Drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: As the trial of local teenager Gary Bell approaches, Sidney and Geordie find themselves in disagreement regarding his guilt. Meanwhile, a man is convinced that his dead wife is haunting his home and stable yards, and implores Sidney to come to his estate and perform an exorcism for him. The vicar offers prayers and counsel, but when the man is found hanged in the exact same spot in which his wife died, Sidney and Geordie are united by a shared goal as they investigate his suicide. Drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green

programme.title: Maigret

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney takes Geordie to Johnny Johnson's London jazz club, hoping to leave their worries in Grantchester for the night, but the backstage murder of Johnny's sister Claudette puts paid to that. When Archie, the victim's father and owner of the club, calls in a police officer pal to crack the case, Geordie immediately detects the copper is corrupt, while Sidney makes an important discovery about Claudette that she had kept hidden from all but those closest to her. As every lead seems to come back to Archie's violent past, recriminations within the family begin to play out

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Amanda and Guy's wedding fast approaching, and his betrayal of Hildegard still fresh in his mind, Sidney is thrown deep into crisis, and the murder of a local cop doesn't help matters as he allows himself to become drawn into another case with Geordie. However, tragedy strikes as the duo close in on the killer, and with Geordie's life hanging in the balance, the clergyman finds himself cut out of the investigation as the police close ranks. programme.desc: An elderly widow enlists Holmes' help to ascertain why a mystery purchaser should want to buy not just her house, but also all its contents. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett, Edward Hardwicke and Peter Wyngarde

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Thomas is hired by a cocktail waitress who wants to bury her father's ashes at the Arizona Memorial but has been refused permission because he was AWOL at the time of death. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A villain comes out of hiding in an attempt to retrieve stolen loot and only Regan and Carter can stop him. Police drama, starring John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Private investigator Caroline Selby seeks Arthur's help in locating eccentric recluse and inventor Albert Goddard, who has come into an inheritance. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar joins forces with a glamorous female agent in order to help liberate John Spring, a double agent whom the Russians believe to be working for them. Roger Moore stars

programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A man dies suddenly of a mysterious fever and Holmes suspects murder, but a malign influence takes its toll on the detective as he delves into the underworld of London's docklands. Starring Jeremy Brett, with Roy Hudd

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole takes a road trip through the glorious Malvern Hills, rips up the tarmac on an MV Agusta, meets a new generation of female bikers and begins the epic rebuild of his Japanese superbike

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: The Hawaii-based private eye offers to help a doctor accused of murdering three patients. Tom Selleck stars

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: The Flying Squad is called in to catch a gunman who has stolen cash from a lock-up. Hard-hitting detective drama, starring John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Terry panics after putting himself in an incriminating position by leaving his fingerprints on a stolen lorry full of electrical items he has collected for Arthur. George Cole and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole rides through the glorious Peak District, from Buxton down to world-renowned Crich Tramway Village. En route he meets Matlock Bath's bikers and explores the notorious history of the Magpie lead mine, while back in the shed, Allen is left to get on with the restoration

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Mark Foster, Charlene White, Ade Adepitan and Kevin Eldon pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: World Rally Championship Highlights
programme.desc: The Rally Sweden. Action from the second round of the campaign, which ventured deep into the frozen and remote forests of north-eastern Sweden from a new home in Umea. Studded tyres provide remarkable grip on snow and ice and, paradoxically, it is one of the season's fastest rounds

programme.title: Assassins (1995)
programme.desc: Hitman Robert Rath is planning to quit his lethal profession, especially when he is stalked by a ruthless younger assassin who has no qualms about killing innocent bystanders. programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: When Dave's relief manager lets him down at short notice, he asks Terry to step into the breach and run the Winchester Club for him. programme.title: The Motorbike Show

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade investigates the mysterious deaths of fishermen in Alaska. A recent fatal incident sends him on a search for possible suspects - first through treacherous rapids, then down to the river-mouth where the icy waters are swarming with sharks. Yet it's an unexpected beast, hauled up from the depths, that eventually emerges as his deadliest contender

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service (1969)
programme.desc: While on leave, James Bond prevents a young woman - Teresa 'Tracy' Draco - from committing suicide. Her father is Marc-Ange Draco, the head of a powerful crime syndicate who is impressed by Bond and wants him to protect his daughter by marrying her. In exchange, he offers Bond information that will lead him to master criminal and arch-enemy Ernst Stavro Blofeld, who is intent on destroying world peace by means of a lethal virus unless he receives an international amnesty for his crimes. Spy adventure, starring George Lazenby in his only outing as 007, alongside Telly Savalas, Diana Rigg, Gabriele Ferzetti and Bernard Lee

programme.title: Arnold Clark Cup Live
programme.desc: Italy Women v Belgium Women (Kick-off 4.45pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of the opening match of the round-robin tournament, held at Stadium MK. With analysis by Anita Asante and commentary from Seb Hutchinson and Eni Aluko

programme.title: Arnold Clark Cup Live
programme.desc: England Women v Korea Republic Women (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from both teams' opening match of the round-robin tournament, held at Stadium MK. England are the holders of this trophy and will hope to get off to a winning start ahead of matches against Belgium and Italy. However, the Koreans, who are managed by Englishman Colin Bell, are the reigning Asian champions and are likely to provide a stern test for Sarina Wiegman's side. With analysis from Ian Wright and Karen Carney, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Emma Hayes

Action thriller, starring Wesley Snipes and Zoe Bell

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. It is Anna's birthday and the Spuds have planned a seaside picnic - when Dave's party food shrinks them all to the size of mugs, the Spuds must adapt and find a way for the celebrations to still go ahead.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave makes a weathervane in his metalwork class at school and tests it on the roof of Grimsby Heights - things go well until his assistant, Gran, gets struck by lightning. programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave helps a local old lady called Tanya, who rewards him by giving him a sausage to say thank you - is Dave imagining it, or does something lucky happen every time he takes a bite?

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. School puts Dave on a work placement with his dad at the local dump - sucked into the mysterious world of rubbish, an old cow and a group of unruly fridges teach Dave an important lesson about recycling.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave orders a water pistol with his birthday money, but he is sent a Happy Sparkle unicorn toy instead - will it bring joy and sparkle into his grumpy world?

programme.desc: Daisy Maskell investigates the influencers using social media to catch out cheaters. She also questions the ethics of the #loyaltytest trend, visiting a TikToker creating content from the hashtag and taking on clients to test their partners

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: In June 1989, 18-year-old Tina Bell vanished after leaving her family home in Billingham, Teesside, to buy some sweets. Ten months later her body was found on nearby wasteland and forensic analysis showed the remains had been dissolved in acid. Emilia Fox, Professor David Wilson and Dr Graham Hill investigate Tina's murder and uncover some sinister events in the community that could be connected to her murder

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The Directing Staff challenge the remaining 11 recruits to stand up and be counted on the fourth phase of the course, as they face a hostage rescue mission hoping to spring two abducted recruits. programme.title: The Last Leg

programme.title: Grayson Perry's Full English
programme.desc: The artist travels through the north of England, beginning his journey on the northern soul scene in Wigan, where he finds this musical genre that developed into a 1960s subculture still has a grip on local people. In Manchester, Grayson meets musician Paul Heaton of the Beautiful South, whose home boasts an eccentric collection of objects celebrating the north and discusses why northern pride continues to be very real. In Cumbria, at the estate of Hutton-in-the-Forest, Grayson meets Lord Inglewood, who believes that the northern spirit transcends class

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The property search focuses its attention on two families who want to move out of their cramped London flats. programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.desc: Food critic Gil takes over the radio show to cover for an ailing Frasier - who immediately fears his job is under threat and resolves to get back on air without delay. Comedy, starring Edward Hibbert and Kelsey Grammer

Catherine wanted to move from the disjointed small roomed bungalow in an isolated location but Nigel, who didn't want to buy the property in the first place, was in love with their large garden with stunning views. programme.desc: Great British Bake Off star Prue Leith and her son Danny Kruger investigate the subject of assisted dying. The mother-and-son duo travel to Canada and the US to get a greater understanding of the topic, and discuss their findings en route. As patron of the pressure group Dignity in Dying, Prue is campaigning for British law to be changed. However, Conservative MP Danny, Chair of Dying Well, is keen to prevent any change to existing circumstances. It remains to be seen whether what they discover in the making of this documentary tempers their attitudes

She never returned, having apparently vanished into thin air. Presenter Emilia Fox, leading criminologist Professor David Wilson and former senior detective Dr Graham Hill investigate the circumstances surrounding Trevaline's disappearance and identify several new suspects

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Brooklyn, New York, to tackle a 55-year-old family business. Owner John Esposito left school at the age of 14 and has worked at his parents' restaurant, Sal's Pizzeria, ever since. Their success meant they could afford to purchase the location next door in the 1990s, naming it Mama Maria after John's mother, who died in 2002. Ben uncovers what prompted this intrepid couple to start a new business and a family in the unforgiving bush, and learns how they have had to overcome fire and flooding to keep their African dream alive

programme.title: The Railway Killers
programme.desc: Documentary about a series of murders of women at railway stations in London in the early 1980s, told through dramatic reconstruction and testimony from police officers and victims' friends. The programme charts the pivotal moments during the police's painstaking investigation, culminating in the eventual conviction of John Duffy and his accomplice David Mulcahy

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the unsolved murder of Crimewatch presenter and newsreader Jill Dando, who was shot dead outside her house in Fulham, west London, in April 1999. Intense media coverage followed and several lines of enquiry were pursued, including a theory that she had been killed by a jealous ex-boyfriend and the idea that somebody had hired a hitman in revenge for a conviction linked to Crimewatch. Following a trial at the Old Bailey, 40-year-old Barry George was found guilty of Dando's murder, but a third appeal quashed his original conviction and resulted in his acquittal in 2009

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow examines the work of Italian Renaissance painter Raffaello Santi, known better simply as Raphael, who was born in 1483 and achieved so much in his 37-year life that he was considered equal to Leonardo da Vinci and Michelangelo. He was highly regarded for his many studies of the Madonna and Child, and artists adopted his idealised forms as the model of beauty until the end of the 19th century

Years after the conflict, the outcast is confronted by his villainous relatives once more as they cause mayhem in his new home town. programme.title: High Noon (1952)
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef

programme.title: The Red Pony (1949)
programme.desc: A boy seeks solace from his feuding family through his friendships with his beloved pony and a ranch hand, whom he idolises. When the animal dies his relationship with his father seems to be damaged irreparably. Drama based on a short story by John Steinbeck, starring Robert Mitchum, Myrna Loy and Peter Miles

programme.title: The Long Arm (1956)
programme.desc: A dedicated Scotland Yard police superintendent battles to overcome stress both at home and work, while putting his instincts and scientific knowledge to the task of catching a notorious safecracker. However, the case takes a shocking turn when the elusive criminal commits murder. Crime thriller, starring Jack Hawkins, Dorothy Alison, Geoffrey Keen and Newton Blick

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility (1995)
programme.desc: An impoverished family is taken in by a relative - and while sensible elder daughter Elinor's love for the sensitive Edward Ferrars meets with disapproval from his family, her more passionate younger sister Marianne engages in a disastrous romance with an infamous womaniser. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, directed by Ang Lee and starring Emma Thompson, Kate Winslet, Alan Rickman and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994)
programme.desc: A London man's misfortunes in love look set to change when he meets an American beauty. However, the prospect of a transatlantic relationship succeeding seems slim, so the pair go their separate ways - only for him to realise he is unable to get her out of his mind. Richard Curtis's comedy, with Hugh Grant, Andie MacDowell, John Hannah, Charlotte Coleman, Kristin Scott Thomas, Simon Callow and James Fleet

programme.title: The Shape of Water (2017)
programme.desc: Elisa Esposito is a mute singleton who lives above a cinema. Although friends with Giles, a neighbouring artist, she lives a lonely existence. While he has designs on the cafe worker nearby, Elisa cleans up at top-secret government lab, a bus ride away in Baltimore, Maryland. One day in 1962, she makes a life-changing discovery when Elisa finds an amphibious humanoid creature who is being held captive, and they embark on an extraordinary relationship. Guillermo del Toro's Oscar and Bafta-winning fantasy, starring Sally Hawkins, Michael Shannon, Octavia Spencer and Doug Jones

programme.title: The Duke of Burgundy (2014)
programme.desc: A butterfly expert develops a sexual relationship with her housekeeper based on sadomasochism. However, while the servant revels in her submissive role, her employer begins to grow weary of dominating her lover, placing a strain on their life together. Drama with an all-female cast, starring Sidse Babett Knudsen and Chiara D'Anna

programme.title: Cowboy (1958)
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk befriends a visiting cowboy and soon talks his way into joining him on a cattle drive so he can impress the woman he loves. The tenderfoot has no idea of what awaits him as he ventures out into the Wild West, an experience that forces him to undergo a dramatic change. Western, starring Jack Lemmon, Glenn Ford, Anna Kashfi and Brian Donlevy

programme.title: Campbell's Kingdom (1957)
programme.desc: A man who has only six months to live returns to the land his family owns in the Canadian Rockies. He intends to prove his grandfather's frequently derided theory that there is oil to be found there, but he has little time to find it, as the area will be flooded when construction is completed on a nearby dam. Adventure, with Dirk Bogarde, Stanley Baker, Michael Craig and Barbara Murray

programme.title: 12 Angry Men (1957)
programme.desc: Twelve jurors convene to decide the verdict in a murder trial. While 11 of the group are thoroughly convinced the teenage defendant is guilty, one lone voice of reason refuses to cave in to pressure and passionately argues the case for his innocence. Sidney Lumet's legal drama, starring Henry Fonda, Lee J Cobb, Ed Begley, Martin Balsam and Jack Klugman

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre (1965)
programme.desc: A corrupt senator coaxes Colonel Custer out of retirement with the prospect of presidential office, and the soldier tries to further his political ambitions by wresting control of the current military campaign from its commanding officer, culminating in his last stand at the Battle of the Little Bighorn. Western, with Philip Carey, Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin and Julie Sommars

programme.title: The Addams Family (1991)
programme.desc: Creepy couple Morticia and Gomez find their unconventional life threatened by a man claiming to be a long-lost relative. When they welcome him with open arms, they fall prey to a plot that could cost them their ancestral home and the family fortune. Black comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci, Jimmy Workman and Carel Struycken

programme.title: Hereditary (2018)
programme.desc: After the death of her mother, artist Annie and her family all mourn her loss in different ways. Annie and her daughter flirt with the supernatural which leads to each having disturbing and worrying encounters with a sinister force. Horror mystery, starring Toni Collette, Milly Shapiro, Gabriel Byrne, Alex Wolff and Christy Summerhays

programme.title: The Orphanage (2008)
programme.desc: A woman brings her family back to her childhood home, which used to be an orphanage. Before long, her son starts to communicate with an invisible new friend. Horror, starring Belén Rueda and Fernando Cayo

programme.desc: A 23-year-old woman discovers she is pregnant, and doodles of her unborn baby start talking to her. Comedy drama, starring Kristine Thorp, Arthur Berning and Nader Khademi. In Norwegian

programme.title: Ministry of Fear (1944)
programme.desc: An innocent man recently released from a mental hospital inadvertently takes possession of a piece of microfilm meant for a Nazi agent, and finds himself on the run from both the police and the Nazis. Fritz Lang's spy thriller, based on Graham Greene's novel, starring Ray Milland, Marjorie Reynolds, Carl Esmond and Hillary Brooke

programme.title: The Wrong Box (1966)
programme.desc: Two elderly brothers each stand to inherit a fortune if the other dies first - but one of them is not prepared to leave anything to chance, and begins a series of disastrous attempts on his unsuspecting sibling's life. However, when one of the pair appears to have really died, his nephews conspire to cover it up. Black comedy, with John Mills, Ralph Richardson, Michael Caine, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore

programme.title: Father Brown (1954)
programme.desc: When works of art start disappearing, stolen by a master thief, Father Brown attempts to catch the culprit and save his soul. Comedy drama, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood and Peter Finch

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral (1957)
programme.desc: US Marshal Wyatt Earp lays down his badge to live a peaceful life with his brothers in the town of Tombstone. As a feud erupts with the ruthless Clanton gang, he forms an unlikely alliance with hard-drinking gambler Doc Holliday to face them in a historic showdown. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Dennis Hopper, Lee Van Cleef and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee (1986)
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum

programme.title: The Girl in the Spider's Web (2018)
programme.desc: Swedish hacker Lisbeth Salander is hired by computer genius Frans Balder to retrieve Firefall, a programme capable of accessing the world's nuclear codes that he developed for the National Security Agency. Though Salander manages to find Firefall, it's not long before she's fighting for her life against mercenaries. Thriller, starring Claire Foy and Sylvia Hoeks

programme.title: No Way Out (1987)
programme.desc: A navy officer unwittingly has an affair with a politician's mistress, and becomes involved in the investigation after she is murdered. However, he soon suspects the plan is to find a scapegoat rather than the real killer - and that he is the most likely candidate to take the fall. Political thriller, starring Kevin Costner, Gene Hackman, Sean Young, Iman and George Dzundza

programme.title: Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit (2014)
programme.desc: A former soldier injured in the line of duty takes up a new career as a financial analyst for the CIA. However, his deskbound position changes to a dangerous undercover assignment when he discovers a plot to destroy the US economy. Spy thriller inspired by Tom Clancy's novels, starring Chris Pine, Keira Knightley, Kevin Costner and Kenneth Branagh, who also directed

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A vulnerable Grace fears for her son's life and plans to leave the village. Meanwhile, Norma comes up with a new plan, and Tony and Diane have a heartfelt conversation

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Diane feels ignored by Tony, and Warren's attempts to win his children's affections end up backfiring. Elsewhere, two old lovers hide their true feelings

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: As the academic year comes to a close, Barry and Erica wonder how they will appear in the school yearbook and pressure Adam, who is on the team producing it, to see the rough layout before it goes to print. Murray is annoyed when Marvin pays a visit to ask for money. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica cannot wait to get out of the house as Graduation Day approaches - until it dawns on her how much her mother's affection means to her. Barry's plans for a summer with Lainey turn to dust, while Dana makes an unexpected visit. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Hayley Orrantia

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon receives a nasty surprise when he visits his mother in Houston, while Raj's murder mystery party causes conflict for the rest of the gang members. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is racked with guilt when he tries to date Lucy and Emily at the same time, Penny has trouble deciding whether to take a role in a film, and Sheldon struggles to choose between two gaming systems. Comedy, starring Kunal Nayyar, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell and Cameron seek legal guardians for Lily and begin secretly assessing their family members. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire and Gloria hope to spend time with their children outdoors, but their plan backfires. Meanwhile, Phil witnesses an unexpected moment of weakness from Jay. American comedy, starring Julie Bowen, Sofia Vergara and Ty Burrell

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Captain Holt and Peralta investigate when three valuable antique coins are stolen from the university where Kevin works as a lecturer. Meanwhile, back at the precinct, Jeffords and Santiago get competitive about taking the squad out for lunch

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and the squad must track down a hacker who has infiltrated the precinct's servers, compromising protected information on undercover agents. Rosa deals with relationship issues, while Hitchcock and Scully attempt to cook the perfect lasagne

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon petitions Wil Wheaton to allow him to appear on the new Professor Proton show, so the actor offers a guest appearance to Amy instead. Meanwhile, Penny gets angry when she thinks the female protagonist in Leonard's novel is based on her

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette's friends each try different tactics to help her go into labour. Howard isn't happy when he finds out that Bernadette has already chosen their son's name without his input

programme.desc: Phil spends quality time with Haley and takes her on a tour of his old college. Meanwhile, Gloria and Jay are forced to talk about an intimate subject with Manny. American comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The gang is quick to help a neighbour whose house has burnt down, but nothing quite works out the way it was intended. American comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.desc: Captain Holt deals with a personal loss. Jake must decide whether to take Terry or Charles to an exclusive event

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

Kathy Bates and Teller (of Penn and Teller fame) guest star as Amy's parents

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: An aspiring Paralympian goes on a date with a former footballer, while a double divorcee hopes to make it third time lucky, if her long list of very specific requirements do not hold her back. A car salesman ponders how to raise the subject of BDSM on his first date with a primary school teacher, and a previous visitor to the bar returns for a second try

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Reviewed shows include The Button, The Queen's Birthday Party, Britain's Got Talent, University Challenge, This Morning, The Real Camilla: HRH The Duchess of Cornwall, and Top of the Shop. First aired in April 2018

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: The Smiths celebrate one of their favourite holidays, while Summer and Morty lock into their new ultra-realistic video game console

programme.title: Smiling Friends
programme.desc: Shrimp asks the team to help him after losing his girlfriend, Shrimpina, so Charlie tries to help Shrimp improve his self-image

programme.title: YOLO: Crystal Fantasy
programme.desc: The friends are watching an art house film starring a hot young actor. When Sarah has a wild romantic dream as a result, Rachel determines to sabotage her friend's fantasy

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean
programme.desc: Natasha and Dave deal with the fallout from the Around the World dinner. The crew pulls together an over-the-top Olympic obstacle course for the guests

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson welcomes the oldest ever picker to the studio, 75-year-old naturist Ian from North Yorkshire. Ian has recently been exploring his sexuality and needs help to find his perfect partner. Next up is 30-year-old waitress Kerry from Aberdeen, who finds the smell of men's armpits gets her hot under the collar and wants a man with a sweet scent who can also get experimental in the bedroom

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits family-run Luigi's in Orange County, California, where lazy shortcuts following the retirement of the owner's father have led the business to suffer. Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam and Murray fall out over Adam's plans to pursue a comedy career after his attempts to be funny in woodwork class nearly result in his teacher getting injured. Beverly and Geoff worry that college is turning Erica into a pretentious snob, but they allow Barry to coach them in the finer points of culture in an attempt to stay close to her

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry looks to secure a spot on the high school football team but is quickly consigned to the bench by Coach Mellor for his lack of sporting prowess. Adam decides to help his brother understand that there are other ways he can contribute to the squad's success

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Comedians Rufus Hound and Jenny Eclair are challenged to make Kimono-style garments against the clock

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Sara and Paul from Derbyshire to find a holiday home in the Murcia region of south-eastern Spain. They're amazed by what their budget of £38,000 can buy them, but whether can they decide which property suits them best remains to be seen

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple with a new B&B argue over renovations, a family of brewers from Kent dash across the Channel to beat lockdown, and a restaurateur from Skegness' finances hang by a thread

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Worcestershire to meet mechanic Adrian. Simon restores an old, wrecked armchair into some punk-rock furniture

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to Surrey to meet upcycler Rob, who has a range of sheds a few miles from Gatwick Airport

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: In Hatfield, Hertfordshire, a researcher struggles to find any clues from neighbours about a retired factory worker whose father survived a First World War PoW camp

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Falmouth, Cornwall, where Gaye Woods hopes her family run Meudon Hotel will win the day. However, guests Tim and Mikey think their twin beds are too close for comfort. For some afternoon fun, Gaye lays on some oyster shucking. At dinner, some of the group are unconvinced by the high room rates and at breakfast, guests Sue and Chris reveal a picky streak. When Gaye receives her feedback, she's left wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Royal Oak pub in Malborough, Devon, run by laid-back owner Tim Heap, with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. The basic rooms are a hit with some guests, but Geoff and Joan discover a mucky corner cupboard. Tim and Mikey take the group to an art workshop for some creative fun. At dinner, the guests are itching to know more about Tim's past and he doesn't disappoint, but he's riled when Gaye questions his unconventional management style. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, some tough feedback makes Tim suspicious

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Angel Guest House in Tiverton, Devon, where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience. Gaye is concerned by the noise of the road outside, and Joan and Geoff question some design choices in their room. During an afternoon playing a local game known as Throw the Egg, the group rumbles how competitive their hosts are. At dinner, Tim's enthusiasm results in an unexpected gift. Egg connoisseur Chris's poached eggs are put to the test at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan's Compton Swan in Newbury, Berkshire. Expectations are high after Joan revealed she was named Ireland's Businesswoman of the Year on the last visit, but Tim, who's still smarting from his feedback, goes to town on his room. Tensions mount during an afternoon on an inflatable racecourse, where Chris and Sue try to sabotage the race. Geoff and Joan impress with a harpist at dinner and hearts are softened when they reveal the personal sacrifices they make for their business. At breakfast, Geoff the chef impresses, but egg-man Chris takes issues with his food

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of serial renters who had very particular tastes, beginning with serial renters Mike and Poppy. Mike has lived in 18 homes, but Poppy wants to put down roots and they've chosen Cheshire as the right spot for their family. However, living in a high spec rental has given them great expectations for the home they'd love to own. Meanwhile, James and Hayley are looking for a rural retreat for themselves and their two dogs in Swindon and Newbury. But they are the first ones to admit that their wish list is extravagant, making Phil Spencer's job a tough one

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help the Clayton-Fishers, who have fallen out of love with their home in Walthamstow, east London. Sarah and her wife Pepper have opposing views on what to do with their two-bedroom terrace, as Sarah thinks it is time to move on, but Pepper is digging her heels in and wants to convert the loft

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge and Angel Adoree host their last wedding of the year, and they welcome a fleet of vintage Citroens, whose drivers are making a pit-stop on a charity tour around France. After a sumptuous breakfast, the cars are on their way, and Dick, Angel, Arthur and Dorothy can focus on a retro vehicle of their own, the 1980s Asquith bus. With Angel's unique design, and Dick's engineering, it soon becomes the camper van the family dreamed of

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Natasha Cargill wants to build a home shaped like two enormous periscopes in rural Norfolk, but to obtain planning permission, she has to ensure not only that the materials are sustainable, but also agree to measure the transportation used to deliver them. If these strict criteria are not met, she won't be allowed to live there, and to add to the pressure, she has just £330,000 to spend on construction and six months to complete the project. Kevin McCloud follows her progress

programme.title: 2022: The Year from Space
programme.desc: Images of the world filmed by satellites over the course of 2022. The film includes footage of the destruction caused during the wars in Ukraine and Tigray, and of wildfires across Europe, as well as the aftermath of Covid lockdowns, as crowds are recorded returning to cities around the world. There is also footage of summer festivals, including Glastonbury and Burning Man. The film also documents the natural world, discovering existence of unknown colonies of king penguins in Antarctica and the plumes of herring spawn in the Pacific

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Cameras reveal what can go wrong when a dream holiday turns into a nightmare. Footage includes sunbed dashes, ski crashes, Brits behaving badly and locals behaving madly, all told by the people who were there. Psychologists and industry experts also reflect on the anxieties and situations that many can experience during a break

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tensions run high at King's College Hospital when police suspect a patient is concealing a weapon, while maybe mother-of-four Hillary arrives in resus with a severe head injury after falling from her horse. Icylyn's bloated abdomen baffles the medical team and she has to wait overnight for a diagnosis, and 14-year-old Chloe receives treatment following her involvement in a fight

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics rush to save the life of a cyclist who has been crushed by a lorry in Leamington Spa, and in Coventry, a man is treated after falling from a barge

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Joe Wilkinson take on Lee Mack and Katherine Ryan in the comedy words-and-numbers game, while the Brett Domino Trio join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr, with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tensions run high at King's College Hospital when police suspect a patient is concealing a weapon, while maybe mother-of-four Hillary arrives in resus with a severe head injury after falling from her horse. Icylyn's bloated abdomen baffles the medical team and she has to wait overnight for a diagnosis, and 14-year-old Chloe receives treatment following her involvement in a fight

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits Manhattan, where she creates candy canes and lollipops at artisan sugar crafter Papabubble, before heading back to the UK to learn how to make passion fruit marshmallows covered in chocolate and coconut

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sue and Mike Bloomfield from Manchester have been holidaying in Portugal for over 20 years. Now that their children have flown the nest - and with Mike's retirement just around the corner - they think the time's right to buy a holiday home on the Algarve, so Jasmine Harman shows them five properties within their budget of £150,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Artisan brewers bottle their first beer in France, a restaurateur from Skegness, Lincolnshire, has his launch party shut down by the Portuguese police and a family from London renovate a French chateau

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Wokingham in Berkshire to meet professional gardener Mark whose barns are brimful of bikes, bric-a-brac and baggage

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Windsor, Berkshire, to meet Roy, whose garages are stacked full of bikes. Henry picks the one that doesn't work to take away, while Simon converts some 17th-century wooden beams into a pair of stylish bedside lamps

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A search in Lancashire uncovers a family hero who flew Wellington bombers during the First World War, and investigators stumble across a mysterious disappearance from the 1960s

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Brighton Surf hotel, where Jeremy and Elena Mann hope their hands-off hosting style will win the approval of their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London, owned by actor and antiques dealer, Robert Gray. Alas, Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week comes from the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich, Kent, with hosts Jan and Les Fisher convinced their traditional place will impress the others

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, where owner Sarah Summers is dreading the arrival of Robert after their confrontation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day sees the B&B owners meet for the last time, with the Brighton Surf Hotel's Jeremy and Elena Mann wanting to defend their no-breakfast remote-hosting concept

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of discerning house-hunters, each with very strong ideas on what they wanted. The searches may have been tough - in some instances they didn't even make it inside some of the properties - but both have faced even more challenging times since. In 2012, couple Robin and Colin wanted to move outside of London, but only an architectural gem was going to do. In 2014, Lia and Andrew said they were done renting in London's popular Isle of Dogs, and wanted to buy their own home now they were starting a family

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp meet the Pogsons in Harrogate, North Yorkshire and offer advice to the family who are unsure whether to renovate their property or find a new home. After living in their three-bedroom house for 16 years, Carol thinks that it is time for a big change, but Andrew is adamant he is not moving house

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: As the beginning of autumn arrives, Dick Strawbridge passes on his conker skills to the family, before the serious business resumes and the next phase of the renovation begins. Dick and his wife Angel Adoree get to work converting the old tack room into a grand entrance way. Angel knocks down walls and upcycles an old glass door, while Dick lays a new concrete floor

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud looks at the challenges of self-building in the UK's most remote places, where beautiful landscapes often meet savage weather. Drawing on footage from 15 years of the programme, as well as new visits to extraordinary and incredible homes, Kevin reveals which designs work best, and why. Along the way, he interviews pioneers at the forefront of architecture in the wilderness and sees the astonishing lengths people go to live on the edges of society

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives
programme.desc: Amanda visits Muhsen, Elif and their three children in Pontypool south Wales to see how these self-taught farmers learned how to raise goats, sheep and cows and produce their own fuel to grow and farm vegetables.

programme.title: Pamela Anderson's Family Home Renovation
programme.desc: The roadhouse gets a major facelift but Pamela insists that the construction workers are not to cut down a single tree branch. Contractor Darren finds a major pest problem presenting environmentalist Pamela with a tough decision to make. Designer Francesca and assistant Jonathan come up with different designs for the garden path for the Hollywood star to choose from

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school
