Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Anne Hogarth first fell in love with Lanzarote over a decade ago and now, after several visits to the island since, is looking for a holiday home to enjoy in her retirement. With her daughter Rachel along for moral support, Jonnie Irwin shows Anne five properties in the resort of Puerto del Carmen for her £85,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp teams up with potter Richard Miller to help Ellie and Nick Harrington - who have no practical DIY skills - create plates to complement their 1930s-style dining room in Tunbridge Wells, Kent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Having worked hard all their lives, Mena and Bal Patel are finally in a position to make their lifelong dream come true and buy a holiday home on Orihuela Costa, their favourite part of Spain. Laura Hamilton shows a number of properties to the pair in a bid to help them realise their dream

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: There's chaos at a B&B in France when a pipe bursts during check in. A restaurateur in Portugal runs out of cutlery, a family of brewers from Kent launch their beer at a prestigious market, while at a B&B in Italy, the guests cannot find the bidet

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo head to Herefordshire to meet George, who has been collecting for more than 70 years. Max finds a crate of vintage motor oil bottles that he thinks could be worth a small fortune

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In the picturesque Devon countryside, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet Derek and Daphne, who have decades of collecting stored in multiple barns. Henry finds a very rare tractor, which he has never found in a shed search before, while a Raleigh Shopper bike really lights Simon's fire

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The home of a retired lift attendant from Leeds goes under the hammer at auction and the team are hoping for a good profit to pass on to any heirs they can find. As they unravel the family tree, they discover that one of her grandfathers rose from groom to coachman to chauffeur as horse-driven vehicles were replaced by turn-of-the-century mechanisation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: No-nonsense bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn arefirst to host at Llwyn Onn Guest House in Betws-y-Coed, north Wales. Former airline cabin crew assistant Nicola Ellershaw makes a less than sparkly discovery when she checks in. Wayne and Tracy challenge their guests to design biker leathers for their own gang, before Jon and Chelli Bean make a shock revelation about Jon's past. At breakfast, Gary Pesticcio challenges his hosts, which his competitors label as game playing, and at feedback time Wayne and Tracy have to face some home truths

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are newlywed hoteliers Jon and Chelli Bean from the Parkwood Hotel in Stockton-on-Tees

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third hosts of the week are Nicola Ellershaw and Mackenzie Griffey, who hope to impress with the stylish fare on offer at The Pug and Greyhound in Leicestershire

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests' final stay is at The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where Gary Pesticcio and his daughter Naomi hope their hi-tech approach to hospitality will impress

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid, and the atmosphere turns sour when Jon and Chelli Bean disagree with Gary and Naomi Pesticcio's thoughts on their facility. Plus, Nicola Ellershaw and Mackenzie Griffey of The Pug and Greyhound in Great Glen want to unlock the reasons why their rooms were described as being 'like prison cells'

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples searching in the Scottish capital. Zoe and Jason are returning to their native Edinburgh after a decade living and working in Hong Kong. They have £950,000 but that will only buy them a flat around their preferred area. Can Phil fulfil their expensive wishlist? Kirstie is with Tan, from Lisbon, and his Fife-born wife Stephanie, who cannot agree on a countryside feel or city vibe

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Alex and Danny Moore in Preston, and offer the pair advice on whether they should renovate their home or put it on the market. Danny wants to do up the property and sell it on, but Alex has other ideas, and thinks the house is the perfect place for them to start a family

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Before winter arrives, Dick Strawbridge and Angel Adoree take on their next project, transforming a 35-foot long, eight-ton river boat into luxury guest accommodation. While Angel completely overhauls the old nautical interior with bespoke fabrics and unique crafts, Dick has the small task of installing the boat's very own wind turbine and a decking that reaches over the moat

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud presents one of four special programmes inspired by 15 years of Grand Designs. He begins with a look at the challenges of self-building in the city, where space is at a premium and architects have to be at their most ingenious. Kevin uses footage from the best urban builds from the show over the years, meets pioneers at the forefront of the latest architectural thinking and looks at clever innovations that continue to transform people's lives to reveal which designs work best and why

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team treats 78-year-old Kevin, who suffered a cardiac arrest at the gym and fortunately received life-saving treatment at the scene from an instructor trained to use a portable defibrillator. Meanwhile, 23-year-old paramedic Declan is sent for an emergency CT scan, and Monica, 83, is experiencing numbness in her leg following a fall at home, and her initial X-ray appears to indicate she has a broken neck

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.

programme.title: Shocking Emergency Calls
programme.desc: A family trip to the Cincinnati Zoo turns into chaos and horror as a three-year-old falls into the enclosure of Harambe, the silverback gorilla. A bride's wedding day should be the happiest day of her life, but not for Kelly Ecker. Through frantic emergency calls the domestic abuse she suffers at the hands of her groom is exposed, resulting in a shocking murder-suicide

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary follows the work of the stroke team at south London's King's College Hospital. Laura's family faces a big decision when the 72-year-old grandmother is found to have a blood clot on her brain, while father-of-three Nic, the over-40s National BMX Champion, collapses in reception after suffering an accident while training for a stunt. The medics also treat 83-year-old Marjorie, who is complaining of a pain behind her eye following a recent bout of shingles

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, as Sarah Millican and Nish Kumar take on Jon Richardson and Maisie Adam. David O'Doherty is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team treats 78-year-old Kevin, who suffered a cardiac arrest at the gym and fortunately received life-saving treatment at the scene from an instructor trained to use a portable defibrillator. Meanwhile, 23-year-old paramedic Declan is sent for an emergency CT scan, and Monica, 83, is experiencing numbness in her leg following a fall at home, and her initial X-ray appears to indicate she has a broken neck

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ex-RAF officers Simon Stenning and Amanda Butcher have been visiting the Caribbean island of Antigua for several years, and now hope to find the perfect winter home there. Ben Hillman helps the pair, showing them five properties for their £330,000 budget

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: The journey of a $55million batch of cancer pharmaceuticals from Northern Ireland to Heathrow, for a flight to the US. A wildlife officer attempts to scare birds away from a runway

programme.title: Fast Justice
programme.desc: The Sentinels are alerted to a possible victim of modern-day slavery. Plus, a drug deal is busted, and a conspiracy theorist shares his curious beliefs with the cops

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: Customs officers rescue a man from the sea at night after he falls from a smuggler's boat, and the Drug Squad raid a suspected dealer's house

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The thrilling finale of the sixth series of the hit format. After seemingly an eternity away, the final Tribal Council takes place, drama unfolds, and the Ultimate Survivor is decided.

programme.title: Fast Justice
programme.desc: The Sentinels floor it in a dramatic high-speed pursuit after a suspected drug dealer. Plus, a lucky break, as a car that previously gave them the slip drives right past the cops

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: In Pharr, 840kg of meth is discovered in the floor of a truck. Aromatic candles filled with Fentanyl are intercepted at the World Trade Bridge

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May work on a project to build mobility scooters capable of tackling the British countryside's terrain. Ferrari's four-wheel-drive FF is pitted against the revised, V8-engined Bentley Continental GT on a test track at the edge of the Arctic Circle, while James puts the Fisker Karma through its paces in Florida, and meets AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe, Colin Lane and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz show. This time, the theme is 'Opposites'. During the course of the show, the panellists find out how to sort the sheep from the goats, discover the opposite of Tarzan, and meet the telescope that points straight through the Earth. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert is at the centre of some satsuma-based controversy and Phil Wang finds his Bruce Lee costume offers an unexpected advantage

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ronni Ancona, Nathan Caton, Colin Murray and Sally Phillips go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Noel Fielding, footballer-turned-presenter Ian Wright and actress Joanna Scanlan reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include spiders, stinky cheese, hangovers and bad toast etiquette

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are snooker veteran Steve Davis, actor Craig Parkinson, comedian Sara Pascoe and Strictly co-host Claudia Winkleman. They all have amazing stories to share, but whether or not they are true or works of fiction remains to be seen

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Katherine Ryan and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the comedy quiz show. This time, Sandi turns attention to topics on the theme of 'Operations'. During the course of the show, the panellists find out how to turn a muffin into an offensive weapon. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Larry Dean and Gary Delaney

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: A UKTV Original return for the thrilling adventure series. Actor Will Mellor cajoles one of his best mates - comedian Keith Lemon - to join him on a high-octane road trip in Albania.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Glenn Moore and Ahir Shah join regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look back on the latest events in news and politics. Once again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry presents an edition of the show celebrating the Cultural Olympiad, asking Bill Bailey, David Mitchell, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies questions about playwright William Shakespeare

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons at Christmas

programme.title: The Other Half
programme.desc: Short film about a closeted, mixed heritage twentysomething. Navid gets the chance to escape his small Welsh town when he lands an internship in Bristol, but as he runs headlong into his new life, he's also running away from the secrets of his old life. Starring Vahid Gold, Paul Chahidi, Samantha Spiro and Justin Edwards

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are trying to make the family healthier, so they are not too happy about the school lollipop man handing out sweets to the kids. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May pay tribute to Saab, the Swedish car manufacturer that created several successful models since the late 1940s, but has now ceased production. Jeremy also shreds the tyres of the noisy Maserati GranTurismo MC Stradale and the 510bhp Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG Black Series

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test the KTM X-Bow, the Morgan Three Wheeler and the Caterham R500 at Donington Park racing circuit. Jeremy also creates his own version of the Battle of Britain using an aircraft-engined Bentley and a flame-spitting BMW

programme.desc: The comedian travels to Mongolia, the most sparsely populated country on Earth. With the aid of a local TV host, he spends a week exploring the vast nation. He also discovers how relationships are formed among nomadic societies, where people often live more than 100 miles away from anyone else

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: During the Vietnam War an elite team of pilots braved terrifying odds by flying unarmed light aircraft over enemy troops to mark targets for America's supersonic strike planes. programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: The former steeplejack and renowned engineering expert looks back on his eventful life with a sense of satisfaction and contentment. The Boltonian then contemplates his future and the possibility of retirement

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next leg of his journey, travelling from London Bridge through Kent and around the scenic south coast to Hastings. He begins by visiting the Royal Observatory to learn how Greenwich Mean Time standardised time on the railways, goes through the world's first underwater tunnel at Rotherhithe and explores the historic dockyards at Chatham

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next leg of his journey from London Bridge to Hastings, exploring the lives of Victorian hop-pickers along the way. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins underground at Big Pit coal mine in Blaenavon, where he discovers how Victorians toiled night and day to power the Industrial Revolution. On the River Usk, he learns about 19th-century developments in angling before heading to Ascott-under-Wychwood in Oxfordshire - once the scene of a farm labourers' dispute that ended in rioting. Michael concludes this leg of his journey at Blenheim Palace

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Beginning in the heart of academia in Oxford, Michael Portillo visits the Bodleian library to see some Victorian treasures, including Mary Shelley's Frankenstein manuscript and a pocket-sized edition of Bradshaw's Companion. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Sandwich to Folkestone, exploring a secret port that helped ferry troops and vital supplies to France in the First World War. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Oakham in Rutland, where he learns about a noble tradition dating back to the Middle Ages and decides to take part. Heading east to Stamford, Lincolnshire, he discovers why the town is such an attractive location for period dramas, while a ghoulish scene awaits in Peterborough when he visits a Victorian operating theatre where railwaymen were treated. Michael's last stop on his journey is Christ's College at Cambridge University, where he finds out about the student days of Charles Darwin

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook, Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the country to discover how the railways have affected people and communities, and the legacy they have left behind. He begins in Manchester, where he finds out how the world's first industrialised city produced a revolutionary political movement, and learns about the railway workers who founded one of the most successful football clubs of all time. Along the way, the presenter does the washing in Port Sunlight - a model village on the Wirral - and hears stories about the aptly named George Francis Train's time in Birkenhead, Merseyside

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has three scooters to collect, while also finding room for a Daimler and a teardrop caravan

programme.title: Nazi Hunters

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor discovers how carving up the landscape in order to build canals helped further man's understanding of the earth below. William Smith, a surveyor on the Somerset Coal Canal, discovered a way of ordering layers of rocks and eventually created the first geological map of England and Wales. His ideas about the age and formation of the earth were developed long before Darwin published his theories of evolution

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo once again ventures onto the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide. He begins in Spain, where he visits the scene of an assassination attempt at a royal wedding in Madrid, before dancing with an unusual partner in Cordoba. He investigates the story behind Bizet's Carmen at a tobacco factory in Seville, learns about Winston Churchill's tense diplomatic mission to Algeciras and finishes with tales of British espionage in Gibraltar

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna meets the Maharaja of Dungarpur who shows her around his lakeside palace, and a Dalit community in Gujarat, considered to be India's lowest caste. Braving the roads of Mumbai, Joanna takes a ride in the city's only all-female taxi company and visits the Times of India, where her uncle was editor of the paper in the 1930s and 40s. She then overcomes her fear of heights to explore the World One Tower, soon to be Mumbai's tallest luxury residential building

programme.desc: The Jewish group the Avengers who, as the Second World War was ending, hunted down persecutors known to have contributed to deaths during the Holocaust, including Wilhelm Stuckart

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor discovers how carving up the landscape in order to build canals helped further man's understanding of the earth below. William Smith, a surveyor on the Somerset Coal Canal, discovered a way of ordering layers of rocks and eventually created the first geological map of England and Wales. His ideas about the age and formation of the earth were developed long before Darwin published his theories of evolution

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels along England's south coast from Hythe to Hastings. Along the way, he discovers a hardy breed of sheep on Romney Marsh, explores Kent's sparkling-wine industry and learns why the Victorians became obsessed with ferns

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey from Ayr to Skye. He begins by visiting the home town of poet Robert Burns and finds out how to make haggis. He then discovers the way in which the railway transformed the game of golf in Prestwick, and uncovers the story of the great Victorian tartan hoax in Paisley

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England in the elegant resort town of Southport, where the railways provided thousands of holidaymakers with the chance enjoy the fun of the fair. On his journey around some of the region's larger towns, the presenter uncovers the history of Victorian entrepreneurship in Wigan and the beginnings of the Industrial Revolution in Bolton, before heading to smaller Leyland to get behind the wheel of a 100-year-old commercial vehicle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England by celebrating Victorian trade with the Preston Guild, and then heading to Rochdale to learn about a pioneering movement to improve the lives of working families. programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor recounts the story of 'canal mania' - a boom period of frenzied activity that helped develop Britain's modern financial economy, now centred in London. The new canal capitalists made money by investing and speculating in waterways used to carry fuel and goods around the country. However, not all canals were profitable and investors soon discovered that such a venture created losers as well as winners

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines the Manchester Ship Canal, hailed as the greatest engineering feat of the Victorian age. Widely regarded as troublesome outsiders who led a drunken life of ungodly debauchery, the navvies who built it toiled in a time of rising trade unionism, prompting Liz to consider how well they managed to organise themselves in campaigning for the best possible deal

programme.desc: Dave Brecknock of Bedfordshire CID investigates a burglary at a country estate in which antiques worth £250,000 have been reported stolen. The man reporting the crime is an orthopaedic surgeon who seems very anxious to make an insurance claim on the stolen property, but the detective senses something about the case doesn't quite add up

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: As an energy crisis and cost of living crisis collide, the Lincolnshire lorry mechanic and motorcycle racer investigates the past, present and future of British power stations to work out how the country makes its most valuable commodity of all - electricity. This first episode begins with Guy testing every piece of equipment in his workshop to find out which items use the most electricity. Horrified by what he's now having to pay for power, he tries to work out the reasons behind his big bills, and visits his local power station at Drax - which also happens to be the country's biggest

programme.title: Building Britain's Superhomes
programme.desc: Guy Phoenix and his team are on a mission to complete their latest superhome build in Nottingham on time and gives a tour of one of his previous property builds. Narrated by Philip Glenister

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Maître d' Fred Sirieix and his team prepare once again to play Cupid at their Manchester restaurant. Essex-born cleaning fanatic Fleur is paired with Essex boy Louis, who reveals he has been working as a high-end escort. Thirty five-year-old Ian, from Co Durham, is full of contradictions, which include working as a gas fitter while also running an art gallery with a champagne bar. it remains to be seen if similarly-aged medical lab assistant Michaela could be the woman to love all of his quirks

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin meets Mike and Sarah, who bought a remote smallholding in the Derbyshire Dales, somewhere to rear animals and provide a home for themselves and their elderly parents. Kevin follows the couple as they set out to build a 21st-century version of a historic Derbyshire longhouse. Enormous, corrugated and with a highly complex roof shape, it was never going to be an easy build. But soon they face delays and their schedule begins to slide. However, that is nothing compared with the problems of a more personal nature that hit the project

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Mimi and Andre d'Costa, who have moved to the Kent countryside to bring up their two children. They have a large plot of land and want to build a house that will be functional enough to serve their young family, but will also blend in with the beautiful landscape. They turn to architect Nick Eldridge, who designs a simple modular home using state-of-the-art materials and technologies

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: A Welsh farmer and his wife plan to upcycle an old horse lorry into a perfect seaside retreat, and George meets a man planning to add a two-storey tepee to his American-inspired campsite. In Israel, the presenter falls for a fantastic modern home and visits a small experimental building made from hemp, which could point the way to a greener future for the construction industry. For his own caravan build, George takes inspiration from an amazing arts and crafts terrace house in Cambridge, and gets together with build partner Max McMurdo to work out how to create an 'invisible' desk

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Briony May Williams is in Germany to uncover why schnapps is always clear despite being made from bright, colourful fruits. Kate Quilton learns why supermarkets carry so many variations of the same herbs, while Jimmy Doherty finds out if there is any difference between soft and crusty bread rolls

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: MA student and part-time waitress Miranda Robinson hosts the first party in Norwich, but some guests find her starter hard to swallow. The main course of sea bass with roasted vegetables will need to impress if she is to stand a chance of walking away with the £1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Danny Bond, also known as Gadget Man, throws the second dinner party in Norwich, pushing his culinary skills to the limit ahead of the event. The food goes down well with his guests, but the host himself is unimpressed with the outcome, and his continued absence from the table disappoints his fellow diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time stand-up comedienne Amy Nicholson hosts the third dinner party in Norwich, but her guests are puzzled by her Middle Eastern menu. When the food is served, its unappetising appearance does not help matters, and local radio DJ Dave Webster steals some of her thunder by revealing he too is a comedian

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Radio DJ Dave Webster hosts the fourth dinner party in Norwich and tries to woo his guests with a Norfolk-inspired menu, but the entertainment is dull and his self-indulgence causes a diner to lose her temper

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cheryl Pennell hosts the final dinner party in Norwich, serving her guests a meal from the back of her fish-and-chip shop van. However, things take a turn for the worse when one of the deep-fat fryers fails to heat up, putting her plans into disarray - but she still hopes to take home the £1,000 prize when the winner is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Laura Hamilton helps Rodney and Lynda Palliser from Hertfordshire search for their dream holiday home near the upmarket, cosmopolitan city of Palma - the capital of Majorca - on a budget of £100,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps builder Martyn and prison manager Sharon find a holiday home on Portugal's Algarve on a budget of £160,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The Spanish bar owners become cocktail waiters and work on the French farmhouse progresses under a tight schedule. In Alicante, a luxury wedding venue suffers a setback

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Councillor Linda Weeks-Holt hosts the first party in Stockport, Greater Manchester, and prepares a rags-to-riches-themed dinner filled with northern delicacies. Despite one guest revealing she knows Prince Charles, Linda reclaims the limelight when she dons a sparkly outfit to entertain her diners on the keyboard

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Annie Targett throws the second party in Stockport, but her insistence on hosting a black-tie event fails to distract the other diners, who begin to search her home for evidence of her allegedly aristocratic lineage

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Civil servant Sam Kitching hosts the third dinner party in Stockport, and intends to put retired policeman John Brinnand in his place while charming the female guests. His Arabian dress code leaves the diners guessing what to wear, and the evening brings out another contestant's competitive spirit

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kristen Cooley takes on the challenge as she hosts the fourth dinner party in Stockport. She plans to dazzle her guests with an American-themed party, but has to overcome the prejudice of her diners, who think this means cheeseburgers and fast-food will be on the menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired police officer John Brinnand hosts the final dinner party in Stockport, Greater Manchester, and hopes to impress his guests with a Thai menu. However, his entertainment is not to everyone's taste, and he discovers how he has fared as the winner of the £1,000 is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: IT business owner Colin and dog trainer Janet met on a cruise three years ago. Their dream is to spend their retirement together in the sunshine and start a new chapter in their lives by buying a holiday home on the eastern Algarve in Portugal. Danni Menzies shows them five great options within their budget of £350,000

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: After seven months, the family reaches the final stage of building their new home, with only waterproofing remaining to be done. They also attend the annual mid-Somerset Show to celebrate all things agricultural from the area, where Sarah is given the honour of judging the cheese contest and Titan the hybrid hen is entered in the poultry competition. Graham also visits the South Devon Chilli Farm to get some tips on making chilli honey

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Cath and her daughter Kate are looking for a tranquil holiday home along the Costa Almeria in southern Spain. Cath wants enough space for her family to be able to visit, but she also wants somewhere to escape the rat race and find inspiration for her writing. Danni Menzies has five great properties lined up for her £170,000 budget, but will any be the oasis of calm that she has her heart set on?

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's an illuminating week in the pottery, as the contenders make a table light with a continuous, embossed scene. In the second challenge, surprise guest judge - fashion and lifestyle designer Henry Holland - really tests their decadent design skills. Siobhán McSweeney hosts, with regular judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller setting the challenges

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Maître d' Fred Sirieix and his team prepare once again to play Cupid at their Manchester restaurant. Essex-born cleaning fanatic Fleur is paired with Essex boy Louis, who reveals he has been working as a high-end escort. Thirty five-year-old Ian, from Co Durham, is full of contradictions, which include working as a gas fitter while also running an art gallery with a champagne bar. it remains to be seen if similarly-aged medical lab assistant Michaela could be the woman to love all of his quirks

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on the State Funeral of HM Queen Elizabeth II. They also offer insightful and passionate takes on The Masked Dancer, Frozen Planet II, Bad Sisters, The Grand Tour: A Scandi Flick, Secret Crush and BBC News

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Dave Brecknock of Bedfordshire CID investigates a burglary at a country estate in which antiques worth £250,000 have been reported stolen. The man reporting the crime is an orthopaedic surgeon who seems very anxious to make an insurance claim on the stolen property, but the detective senses something about the case doesn't quite add up

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: In June 1989, 18-year-old Tina Bell vanished after leaving her family home in Billingham, Teesside, to buy some sweets. Ten months later her body was found on nearby wasteland and forensic analysis showed the remains had been dissolved in acid. Emilia Fox, Professor David Wilson and Dr Graham Hill investigate Tina's murder and uncover some sinister events in the community that could be connected to her murder

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The Directing Staff challenge the remaining 11 recruits to stand up and be counted on the fourth phase of the course, as they face a hostage rescue mission hoping to spring two abducted recruits. The second leadership challenge is a punishing head to head team ammunition supply race, requiring grit and determination to get the job over the line

programme.title: Jon & Lucy's Odd Couples
programme.desc: Married comedians Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont oversee proceedings as TV presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia vie against comic couple Harriet Kemsley and Bobby Mair to decide which of the couples has the better relationship

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: 46 year-old Sara is rushed in after a car crash with serious head and chest injuries, and 54 year-old Simon comes in after falling off his bike on his way to buy a helmet. As his condition deteriorates, Simon looks back on his life and the things he wishes he had done differently. Sixteen year-old James comes in with a severed finger after trying to climb a fence

programme.title: Everyone Else Burns
programme.desc: David takes Aaron to a caravan for some father-son bonding, but there's no electricity and the only running water is leaking through the ceiling. Fiona hosts a girls' night

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events manager Peter Ferguson hosts the first party in Edinburgh, but his guests are less than impressed with his pricey chateaubriand main course. After a gospel choir provides the evening's entertainment, one guest finds herself in trouble, leaving another diner speechless

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alison Lynch hosts the dinner party in Edinburgh, and attempts to win her guests over with a ju-jitsu-themed evening. Rena Martin appears to be endearing herself to the group, and Cynthia Gentle impresses Gary Reid by telling him what she can do with a mango

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Cynthia Gentle hopes to win over her guests with a theme of 1950s glamour and an international menu, featuring a main course that includes crocodile, as she hosts the third dinner party in Edinburgh. Security firm boss Gary Reid decides to provoke a debate on fidelity, while tensions erupt between ju-jitsu teacher Alison Lynch and events manager Peter Ferguson

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Health worker Rena Martin opts for a decadent menu as she hosts the fourth dinner party in Edinburgh, but the rowdy atmosphere proves too much for one of the guests, who ends up asking for a taxi home

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Security manager Gary Reid hosts the final dinner party in Edinburgh, and installs cameras in his dining room to ensure he caters for his guests' needs. Alison Lynch and Peter Ferguson continue to argue, but tensions are forgotten over a cracker-eating game, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ruth Jobey wants to escape from her busy London life to the relaxed town of Oliva on Spain's Costa del Azahar, or 'orange blossom coast'. She wants a detached villa with a swimming pool and views, so Ben Hillman shows her some properties for her £150,000 budget that meet that criteria

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps IT business owner Colin and dog trainer Janet find a home on the Algarve in Portugal for retirement on a budget of £350,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Trial guests test out the French B&B and reality sets in for the bar owners in Spain. In Alicante there are bells ringing at the luxury wedding venue

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Greater Manchester, the first host, 55-year-old DJ and hairdresser Mozz from Bury, makes garlic Stilton mushrooms and poached pear, and pulls out all the stops with a party atmosphere and his entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Manchester, voiceover artist and film extra Matt cooks up a Jewish Friday night supper, including his mum's traditional chicken soup

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Budding author and mum-of-five Cleona is next to host in Manchester, hoping a menu based on her Jamaican roots will get her guests onside

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Australian radio content director James hosts the fourth party in Manchester, hoping his menu containing Chinese cuisine and his mum's cake recipe can land him the top spot

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events boss Sharon hosts the final night in Manchester. With her hearty decadent menu on offer, she has to win over Cleona after a bust up on from Cleona's turn as host. Sharon's skills and decorum are put to the test, though Mozz, Matt and James are on hand for moral support

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson helps fitness instructor Katie and her eldest son Michael, who have travelled the world together, but Paphos, Cyprus is the place they have both fallen in love with

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Documentary continuing the real-life adventures of property expert Sarah Beeny, her husband Graham Swift and their four sons after quitting their lives in London to start anew at a former dairy farm in Somerset. The shell of their mini mansion is built but the home is far from ready, and they are tackling the interior one room at a time. First up is the grand hallway - but first the downstairs needs a concrete floor. Away from the build, Sarah is adding a second beehive and family dog Maple has a surprise in store

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: In New York, the TWA Hotel is close by the John F Kennedy International Airport. Its interiors hark back to the spirit of the 1960s jet age, but with a 21st-century twist. Here, visitors can check in at the old baggage check and enjoy dining in what used to be an airport lounge. In Finnish Lapland, visitors to the snow-capped forest of the Urho Kekkonen National Park can spend a night sleeping under the stars at the Kakslauttanen Arctic Resort. This getaway boasts 65 state-of-the-art, arctic-resistant glass igloos. There are also visits to unique and unusual hotels in Canada and Scotland

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with Catherine and Nigel four years after their first visit when they helped them decide what to do with their home in Larne, Northern Ireland. Catherine wanted to move from the disjointed small roomed bungalow in an isolated location but Nigel, who didn't want to buy the property in the first place, was in love with their large garden with stunning views. While Phil took the pair to see some impressive but affordable houses, Kirstie came up with a plan to repurpose their space. Now they're back to see if the pair stuck to their decision

programme.title: Infinite (2021)
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The road crime team leads a county lines drugs crackdown in Chesterfield, capturing three suspects believed to be ferrying crack cocaine and heroin into Derbyshire on a regular basis. programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents an edition focusing on young drivers. A silver Astra leads Dan on a 100mph chase down the A1M before doing a U-turn into oncoming traffic, while an unlicensed teen tries to deny being the driver of a speeding BMW, but Rich is not fooled

programme.desc: Dog handler Steve and the firearms team are involved in a dramatic doorstep showdown in which a man is alleged to have attacked someone with an axe and a machete. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Bob and BoBo are in pursuit of a clapped-out white van through the back streets, where a dead end brings the vehicle to an abrupt halt and the occupants make off on foot. programme.title: Police Interceptors

Jane's been treated to the trip as a birthday gift from her generous friends - though she feels that life at sea might not be for her. Another new passenger is Scottish grandmother Alison, who plans to embrace everything the ship has to offer, from game shows to bar crawls - and even a tattoo from the ship's on-board tattoo parlour

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red
programme.desc: Dr Hadassa Ihlenfeldt and critical care paramedic Ash Mulindar are called to a tower block in Birmingham where a man who has overdosed on heroin is unconscious and barely breathing. programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: At West Orchards in Coventry, security guard Lewis receives a call from a store that needs urgent assistance. The first sees them taking on a pattern as complex as origami with no diagrams to help, complete an alteration task and end by fitting an avant-garde dress for a model. The judges then consider their verdict before Claudia Winkleman announces who has won

programme.title: Dr. Pimple Popper: Before The Pop
programme.desc: Shakisaha's earlobe split in half during a failed body modification attempt. After a flesh-eating disease, Kelly Ann developed a huge leg growth

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: The crew visits the Waverly Hills Sanatorium in Kentucky. It was once the final destination for tuberculosis patients - is the building now haunted?

programme.title: Ghosts of Devil's Perch

programme.title: Ghost Adventures

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: Pete and his new partner Steve Jinks investigate who or what is responsible for the deaths of two people loosely linked to the same hotel - but their progress is thwarted by FBI agent Sally Sikowski

programme.desc: When Ezekiel's career criminal mother steals a magic door, the team must use Santa's sleigh to save her, as well as Christmas itself, from the Patron Saint of Thieves

programme.desc: An assault on the shuttle leaves Chakotay fighting for his life, with his bioneural energy down to dangerously low levels. Sci-fi adventure, starring Robert Beltran and Tim Russ

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team are called to a warehouse holding a Mardi Gras float after petty officer Jonathan Bell is found murdered there. The victim is discovered to have been in a long-term online relationship with a woman called Maria Garcia and Pride concludes he was about to ask her to marry him, while further online investigations reveal that Bell had never met Maria in the flesh and that she may have been seeing Rodney Abbott as well. Crime drama, starring Scott Bakula and Lucas Black

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross travels to Calais, where there are thought to be more than 3,000 migrants living in squalor, all with the same goal - to reach the shores of the UK and claim asylum from the politically corrupt and, in some cases, violent countries from which they have fled. Some fail to make the 21-mile trip across the English Channel, some die or suffer injuries, and others are arrested. But as Ross learns, most come back another day to try their luck again

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: The actor rides along with some of Australia's notorious motorcycle clubs. Major players in the country's drug trade, the battle for control has led to bombings, multiple murders and more than a thousand shootings - leading 26 clubs to be classified as criminal organisations in 2013. Although the bikers traditionally operate a no-media rule, Ross and his team negotiate access into their secretive world

programme.title: Border Security: Canada's Front Line
programme.desc: The work of officers of the Canada Border Services Agency as its staff enforce customs, quarantine, immigration and finance laws. Whether intercepting suspicious characters, identifying toys packed with drugs or finding weapons disguised as mobile phones, this documentary presents a revealing look at daily life on the front line of national security

programme.title: Border Security: Canada's Front Line

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard finds himself embroiled in the hunt for an escaped prisoner at an Angosian penal colony, only to discover a sinister secret involving the inmates. Patrick Stewart stars

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: Peter and Myka investigate the illness of two men who are scheduled to testify in a murder trial and seem to be rapidly regressing to childhood

programme.title: The Librarians
programme.desc: The team gets sucked into a movie, and they will need all of their skills to make it out alive. Fantasy adventure, directed by Star Trek veteran Jonathan Frakes

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: The disease-ridden Vedeans kidnap B'Elanna Torres and subject her to a series of genetic experiments in an effort to develop a cure for their wasting illness. When two versions of the engineer are created - one human, one Klingon - they work together to find a way of getting back to Voyager. Sci-fi drama, starring Roxann Biggs-Dawson

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The recovery of a stolen gun leads the team to reinvestigate the death 40 years previously of Jacob Tarlow, a Jewish officer who was involved in recruiting black Americans into the navy in the 1970s. Tarlow had been targeted by Ku Klux Klan members and was found hanged from a tree, but the death was ruled as suicide. The reappearance of the victim's sidearm is enough evidence to reopen the case and the team is led to Tom Hamilton, an ex-police officer who it is claimed was involved in the attack. Guest starring Dean Stockwell (Quantum Leap)

programme.title: Manifest
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Stones are reunited with Olive, but their happiness is quickly interrupted when they discover Cal has run away. Michaela struggles to help the passengers avoid a deadly threat and her relationship with Jared sours over mistrust, while Ben and Saanvi undertake a treacherous mission to save someone they love

programme.title: Manifest
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ben and Vance plan to steal the tailfin, while Grace and Olive piece together Cal's drawings for clues. Eagan and Adrian incite a group of passengers, including Angelina, claiming that the Stones are working with the NSA

programme.title: Britain's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A look at Vincent Tabak, the man responsible for the murder of Joanna Yeates, which triggered one of the biggest-ever police investigations in Bristol

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: Detective Jon Buehler looks back at his investigation into the drive-by-shooting of athlete Sulu Palega, a crime that took place in San Francisco in 1994

programme.title: Caribbean Cops
programme.desc: Two British tourists cause havoc when they go on a hunt for Jamaica's legendary aphrodisiac soup

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: A dragon-beast comes to life when the Emperor of the Darkest Yin takes over Ling's body

programme.title: Blandings
programme.desc: Beach and Connie are far from impressed when Clarence grows a raggedy beard - but the least happy is Freddie, who has little chance of impressing Hollywood starlet Pauline Petite if his aristocratic father looks like an old tramp. Period comedy, starring Timothy Spall, Jennifer Saunders, Jack Farthing, Michael Brandon and Zoe Boyle

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Serving the Royals
programme.desc: Personal stories of the royal household's servants, including consultants, advisers and protectors of the House of Windsor

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen visit Dorset and sample food from Dorchester, where they find out about some of the famous names associated with the town. They also dine at the courtroom of the hanging judge, Judge Jeffreys, and sample pie and chips at the old architect's office used by Thomas Hardy. Their pursuit for the best local food takes them to a garlic farm, a chocolate factory and a vicar who supplies the local cider

programme.title: Michael Palin's New Europe
programme.desc: The veteran traveller completes his journey around eastern Europe. He learns how to skin a pig and make sausages in the Tatra mountains of Slovakia, enjoys a mud bath with the 2006 Miss World Tatana Kucharova in the spa town of Karlovy Vary and visits Turba's famous mime school in the Czech Republic. Finally, he travels to the holiday complex at Prora on the island of Rug, Germany, which was built by Hitler for his 'Strength Through Joy' programme

programme.title: Two and Two Make Six (1961)
programme.desc: A womanising member of the US Air Force lands himself in trouble, goes AWOL and heads for the seaside, where he accidentally swaps girlfriends with a motorcyclist. Romantic comedy, starring George Chakiris, Janette Scott and Alfred Lynch

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Devil's Disciple (1959)
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family is befriended by a minister. A case of mistaken identity leads both men to discover their true vocations during the American War of Independence. Historical drama based on George Bernard Shaw's play, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas and Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered.

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: It would appear that the Mona Lisa has been stolen from the Louvre. But is it the actual Da Vinci painting or a forgery substituted to thwart the thieves?

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six breaks out of the Village and returns to London, where he tries to convince his former employees his ordeal was not a figment of his imagination

programme.title: Royal Road
programme.desc: The public activities of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth during the Second World War, as well as the Royal Family's private life in the gardens at Windsor

programme.title: The Royal Visit to Leith
programme.desc: Colourful commemoration of Royal Yacht Britannia's majestic visit to Leith in 1956, courtesy of Joseph and J Arthur Rank

programme.title: After Henry
programme.desc: 1990s British Sitcom. Series 6, Ep 6/6 The Other Married Man. Having sorted out the problem of Clare seeing a married man, Sarah now finds herself in an alarmingly similar situation.

programme.title: The Escape Artist
programme.desc: Liam Foyle is back in the dock and Maggie is leading his defence, determined to prove she is Will's equal by getting the serial killer acquitted. The prosecution barristers are less confident - with no physical evidence and key witness Will unable to get involved, they need all the help they can get. As the defendant continues to terrorise his loved ones, can the brilliant barrister find a way to assist without jeopardising the trial? Courtroom drama, starring David Tennant, Ashley Jensen, Sophie Okonedo and Toby Kebbell

programme.title: Dracula (1974)
programme.desc: The vampire count comes to Victorian London in pursuit of a woman who is the exact double of his long dead wife. Horror, starring Jack Palance and Simon Ward

programme.title: Saturday Church (2017)
programme.desc: Ulysses, a shy, bullied 14-year-old, lives with his mother, Amara, and younger brother. Given the recent passing of his father, Ulysses' Aunt Rose, agrees to help take care of him and his sibling while their mother is at work. He soon stumbles across a vibrant transgender community while trying to find his own identity. Writer/director Damon Cardasis's drama, starring Luka Kain, Regina Taylor and Margot Bingham

programme.title: The Village in the Woods (2019)
programme.desc: Troubled couple Jason and Rebecca get more than they bargain for when they inherit a remote fog-shrouded pub, It seems there's more to their neighbours than meets the eye, but have they got the newcomers' best interests at heart or are more sinister forces at play? Horror, starring Robert Vernon, Beth Park and Therese Bradley

programme.title: The Devil's Disciple (1959)
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family is befriended by a minister. A case of mistaken identity leads both men to discover their true vocations during the American War of Independence. Historical drama based on George Bernard Shaw's play, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas and Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: A mad scientist becomes a werewolf-like monster when he tries to turn himself into a formidable man-dog

programme.title: Blandings
programme.desc: Colonel Fanshawe calls to sound out Clarence as his successor as Lord Lieutenant of Shropshire, an honour for which Connie is desperate, prompting her to do everything in her power to impress their influential visitor. But what possible chance does she have when manservant Beach starts acting very oddly indeed? James Fleet guest stars

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: It would appear that the Mona Lisa has been stolen from the Louvre. But is it the actual Da Vinci painting or a forgery substituted to thwart the thieves?

programme.title: Royal Road
programme.desc: The public activities of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth during the Second World War, as well as the Royal Family's private life in the gardens at Windsor

programme.title: The Royal Visit to Leith
programme.desc: Colourful commemoration of Royal Yacht Britannia's majestic visit to Leith in 1956, courtesy of Joseph and J Arthur Rank

programme.title: After Henry
programme.desc: 1990s British Sitcom. Series 6, Ep 6/6 The Other Married Man. Having sorted out the problem of Clare seeing a married man, Sarah now finds herself in an alarmingly similar situation.

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels around the UK coast by train, beginning by boarding the famous Jacobite steam train for a trip along Scotland's West Highland Railway, famously featured in the Harry Potter movies. Along the way, Julie learns about herring gutting and blowing up railway lines, and meets a traditional Scottish storyteller on the Isle of Skye

programme.title: The Bulldog Breed (1960)
programme.desc: A bumbling grocer is rejected by the woman of his dreams, plunging him into misery. He decides to get over his heartbreak by joining the Navy, and despite his ineptitude, is selected by an admiral to become Britain's first astronaut. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Ian Hunter, David Lodge and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Time Limit (1957)
programme.desc: A soldier held as a POW during the Korean War confesses to having assisted the enemy during his imprisonment. His superior officers are determined to see him face a court martial as soon as possible, but the investigator assigned to the case suspects he is an innocent man incriminating himself to hide something. Korean War drama, with Richard Widmark and Richard Basehart

programme.title: Blenheim
programme.desc: The paparazzi invade as England footballer John Terry gets married at the palace. Actor Jude Law also drops by and the Duke of Marlborough poses for photographs at the launch of a new food range

programme.title: Blenheim
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes footage of life in the famous stately home, covering a year in the life of Blenheim Palace. Following the Duke and Duchess of Marlborough and key members of staff

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Harvey is given the brush-off by his son's schoolteacher, and Lou is forced to spend time recovering

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of US Airways Flights 1549, which lost engine power after a collision with a flock of birds, leaving Captain Sully Sullenberger to land the plane on the Hudson River

programme.title: The Hidden City
programme.desc: Vince tries to get a job

programme.title: Loot (1970)
programme.desc: A crook hides the proceeds from a robbery in his mother's coffin. Black comedy, starring Lee Remick and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: Awaydays (2009)
programme.desc: A bored and disaffected young man seeks an outlet for his pent-up aggression. He befriends a member of a local football hooligan group and falls in with the crowd, finding release in drink, drugs, football and fighting. Drama set in the 1980s, based on Kevin Sampson's novel, starring Nicky Bell, Stephen Graham, Liam Boyle and Oliver Lee

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.desc: A lowly window cleaner uses his wiles and ruthlessness to climb the corporate ladder. Musical comedy based on the Broadway show, starring Robert Morse, Michele Lee, Rudy Vallee and Anthony Teague

programme.desc: A gambler visits a ranch owned by the mother of four infamous outlaw brothers. Western, with Clark Gable, Eleanor Parker and Jo Van Fleet

programme.title: The Escape Artist
programme.desc: Liam Foyle is back in the dock and Maggie is leading his defence, determined to prove she is Will's equal by getting the serial killer acquitted. The prosecution barristers are less confident - with no physical evidence and key witness Will unable to get involved, they need all the help they can get. programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Burnley v Watford (Kick-off 8.00pm). Live coverage of the Championship clash from Turf Moor, as the two former Premier League teams go head to head. The home side are having a brilliant season under new manager Vincent Kompany, and are well clear of third place and heading for automatic promotion. The visitors got rid of manager Rob Edwards in September and have thrived under new boss Slaven Bilic since then

programme.title: EFL Cup Retro
programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur in the 2008/09 final. Spurs were managed by Harry Redknapp and had a strong run that led them to the final of the competition, having beaten the likes of Newcastle, Liverpool and Watford in previous rounds. The Red Devils had beaten Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Blackburn Rovers in the early rounds, before beating Derby County 4-3 on aggregate
